verses.textEn: These are the words which Moses spoke to all of Israel, across the Jordan, in the plain of the wilderness opposite the Red Sea, between Paran and Tophel and Laban and Hazeroth, where gold is very plentiful,
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt verba, quæ locutus est Moyses ad omnem Israel trans Iordanem in solitudine campestri, contra Mare Rubrum, inter Pharan et Thophel et Laban et Haseroth, ubi auri est plurimum:

verses.textEn: eleven days from Horeb, by way of Mount Seir as far as Kadesh-barnea.
verses.textLa: undecim diebus de Horeb per viam montis Seir usque ad Cadesbarne.

verses.textEn: In the fortieth year, on the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, Moses told the sons of Israel all that the Lord had instructed him. And so he spoke to them,
verses.textLa: Quadragesimo anno, undecimo mense, prima die mensis locutus est Moyses ad filios Israel omnia quæ præceperat illi Dominus ut diceret eis:

verses.textEn: after he had struck down Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan, who resided at Ashtaroth and at Edrei,
verses.textLa: postquam percussit Sehon regem Amorrhæorum, qui habitabat in Hesebon: et Og regem Basan, qui mansit in Astaroth, et in Edrai,

verses.textEn: across the Jordan in the land of Moab. And so, Moses began to explain the law, and to say:
verses.textLa: trans Iordanem in Terra Moab. Cœpitque Moyses explanare legem, et dicere:

verses.textEn: “The Lord our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying: ‘You have remained long enough on this mountain.
verses.textLa: Dominus Deus noster locutus est ad nos in Horeb, dicens: Sufficit vobis quod in hoc monte mansistis:

verses.textEn: Turn back and go to the mountain of the Amorites, and to the other places which are near it: the plains as well as the mountainous regions, and the low-lying places opposite the south and along the shore of the sea, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river Euphrates.’
verses.textLa: revertimini, et venite ad montem Amorrhæorum, et ad cetera quæ ei proxima sunt campestria atque montana et humiliora loca contra Meridiem, et iuxta littus maris, Terram Chananæorum, et Libani usque ad flumen magnum Euphraten.

verses.textEn: ‘Lo,’ he said, ‘I have delivered it to you. Enter and possess that which the Lord swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, that he would give it to them, and to their offspring after them.’
verses.textLa: En, inquit, tradidi vobis: ingredimini et possidete eam, super qua iuravit Dominus patribus vestris Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob, ut daret illam eis, et semini eorum post eos.

verses.textEn: And I said to you, at that time:
verses.textLa: Dixique vobis illo in tempore:

verses.textEn: ‘I alone am not able to sustain you. For the Lord, your God, has multiplied you, and you are today like the stars of heaven, very many.
verses.textLa: Non possum solus sustinere vos: quia Dominus Deus vester multiplicavit vos, et estis hodie sicut stellæ cæli, plurimi.

verses.textEn: May the Lord, the God of your fathers, add to this number many thousands more, and may he bless you, just as he has said.
verses.textLa: (Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum addat ad hunc numerum multa millia, et benedicat vobis sicut locutus est.)

verses.textEn: Alone, I do not have the strength to endure your arbitrations and judgments and disputes.
verses.textLa: Non valeo solus negotia vestra sustinere, et pondus ac iurgia.
verses.notes: The word ‘pondus’ literally refers to weights or to weighing something, but figuratively it refers to making a judgment about something. The word ‘negotia’ can refer to business dealings generally, but in this context it refers more to business disputes.

verses.textEn: Offer, from among you, wise and experienced men, those whose conversation has been proven within your tribes, so that I may appoint them as your rulers.’
verses.textLa: Date ex vobis viros sapientes et gnaros, et quorum conversatio sit probata in tribubus vestris, ut ponam eos vobis principes.

verses.textEn: Then you responded to me: ‘What you intend to do is a good thing.’
verses.textLa: Tunc respondistis mihi: Bona res est, quam vis facere.

verses.textEn: And so, I took from your tribes men, wise and noble, and I appointed them as rulers, as tribunes and centurions, and as leaders over fifty and over ten, who would teach you each thing.
verses.textLa: Tulique de tribubus vestris viros sapientes et nobiles, et constitui eos principes, tribunos, et centuriones, et quinquagenarios ac decanos, qui docerent vos singula.

verses.textEn: And I instructed them, saying: ‘Listen to them, and judge what is just, whether he is one of your citizens or a sojourner.
verses.textLa: Præcepique eis, dicens: Audite illos, et quod iustum est iudicate: sive civis sit ille, sive peregrinus.

verses.textEn: There shall be no favoritism to any persons. So you shall listen to the little as well as to the great. And you shall not accept anyone’s reputation, for this is the judgment of God. But if anything seems difficult to you, then refer it to me, and I will hear it.’
verses.textLa: Nulla erit distantia personarum, ita parvum audietis ut magnum: nec accipietis cuiusquam personam, quia Dei iudicium est. Quod si difficile vobis visum aliquid fuerit, referte ad me, et ego audiam.

verses.textEn: And I instructed you in all that you were obliged to do.
verses.textLa: Præcepique omnia quæ facere deberetis.

verses.textEn: Then, setting out from Horeb, we crossed through a terrible and great wasteland, which you saw along the way of the mountain of the Amorite, just as the Lord our God had instructed us. And when we had arrived at Kadesh-barnea,
verses.textLa: Profecti autem de Horeb, transivimus per eremum terribilem et maximam, quam vidistis, per viam montis Amorrhæi, sicut præceperat Dominus Deus noster nobis. Cumque venissemus in Cadesbarne,

verses.textEn: I said to you: ‘You have arrived at the mountain of the Amorite, which the Lord our God will give to us.
verses.textLa: dixi vobis: Venistis ad montem Amorrhæi, quem Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.

verses.textEn: Gaze upon the land that the Lord your God gives to you. Ascend and possess it, just as the Lord our God has spoken to your fathers. Do not be afraid, and do not become terrified by anything.’
verses.textLa: Vide Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dat tibi: ascende et posside eam, sicut locutus est Dominus Deus noster patribus tuis: noli timere, nec quidquam paveas.

verses.textEn: And you all approached me and said: ‘Let us send men who may consider the land, and who may report as to the way by which we ought to ascend, and as to which cities we ought to travel.’
verses.textLa: Et accessistis ad me omnes, atque dixistis: Mittamus viros qui considerent Terram: et renuncient per quod iter debeamus ascendere, et ad quas pergere civitates.

verses.textEn: And since the word was pleasing to me, I sent from among you twelve men, one from each tribe.
verses.textLa: Cumque mihi sermo placuisset, misi ex vobis duodecim viros, singulos de tribubus suis.

verses.textEn: These, when they had set out and had ascended the mountains, arrived as far as the valley of the cluster of grapes. And having considered the land,
verses.textLa: Qui cum perrexissent, et ascendissent in montana, venerunt usque ad Vallem Botri: et considerata terra,

verses.textEn: having taken from its fruits in order to show its fertility, they brought these to us, and they said: ‘The land that the Lord our God will give to us is good.’
verses.textLa: sumentes de fructibus eius, ut ostenderent ubertatem, attulerunt ad nos, atque dixerunt: Bona est terra, quam Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.

verses.textEn: Yet you were not willing to go there. Instead, being incredulous to the word of the Lord our God,
verses.textLa: Et noluistis ascendere, sed increduli ad sermonem Domini Dei nostri

verses.textEn: you murmured in your tents, and you said: ‘The Lord hates us, and therefore he has led us away from the land of Egypt, so that he might deliver us into the hand of the Amorite and destroy us.
verses.textLa: murmurastis in tabernaculis vestris, atque dixisitis: Odit nos Dominus, et idcirco eduxit nos de Terra Ægypti, ut traderet nos in manu Amorrhæi, atque deleret.

verses.textEn: To where should we ascend? The messengers have terrified our heart by saying: “The multitude is very great, and taller than us. And the cities are great, and the walls extend even to the sky. We have seen the sons of the Anakim there.” ’
verses.textLa: Quo ascendemus? nuncii terruerunt cor nostrum, dicentes: Maxima multitudo est, et nobis statura procerior: urbes magnæ, et ad cælum usque munitæ: filios Enacim vidimus ibi.

verses.textEn: And I said to you: ‘Do not be apprehensive, nor should you fear them.
verses.textLa: Et dixi vobis: Nolite metuere, nec timeatis eos:

verses.textEn: The Lord God himself, who is your leader, will fight on your behalf, just as he did in Egypt in the sight of all.
verses.textLa: Dominus Deus, qui ductor est vester, pro vobis ipse pugnabit, sicut fecit in Ægypto cunctis videntibus.

verses.textEn: And in the wilderness (as you yourselves saw), the Lord your God carried you, like a man who is accustomed to carrying his little son, along all the way that you walked, until you arrived at this place.’
verses.textLa: Et in solitudine (ipse vidisti) portavit te Dominus Deus tuus, ut solet homo gestare parvulum filium suum, in omni via, per quam ambulastis, donec veniretis ad locum istum.

verses.textEn: And yet, despite all of this, you did not believe the Lord your God,
verses.textLa: Et nec sic quidem credidistis Domino Deo vestro,

verses.textEn: who went before you on the way, and who marked out the place where you should pitch your tents, showing you the way by fire in the night, and by a pillar of cloud in the day.
verses.textLa: qui præcessit vos in via, et metatus est locum, in quo tentoria figere deberetis, nocte ostendens vobis iter per ignem, et die per columnam nubis.

verses.textEn: And when the Lord had heard the voice of your words, becoming angry, he swore and said:
verses.textLa: Cumque audisset Dominus vocem sermonum vestrorum, iratus iuravit et ait:

verses.textEn: ‘None of the men of this wicked generation will see the good land, which I have promised by oath to your fathers,
verses.textLa: Non videbit quispiam de hominibus generationis huius pessimæ Terram bonam, quam sub iuramento pollicitus sum patribus vestris:

verses.textEn: except Caleb the son of Jephuneh. For he himself will see it, and I will give the land on which he has walked to him and to his sons, because he has followed the Lord.’
verses.textLa: præter Caleb filium Iephone. Ipse enim videbit eam, et ipsi dabo Terram, quam calcavit, et filiis eius, quia secutus est Dominum.

verses.textEn: Neither is his indignation with the people a wonder, since the Lord also became angry with me because of you, and so he said: ‘Neither will you enter into that place.
verses.textLa: Nec miranda indignatio in populum, cum mihi quoque iratus Dominus propter vos dixerit: Nec tu ingredieris illuc:

verses.textEn: But Joshua, the son of Nun, your minister, shall himself enter on your behalf. Exhort and strengthen this man, and he himself shall divide the land by lot to Israel.
verses.textLa: sed Iosue filius Nun minister tuus, ipse intrabit pro te. Hunc exhortare et robora, et ipse sorte Terram dividet Israeli.

verses.textEn: Your little ones, about whom you said that they would be led away as captives, and your sons, who to this day are ignorant of the difference between good and evil, they shall enter. And I will give the land to them, and they will possess it.
verses.textLa: Parvuli vestri, de quibus dixistis quod captivi ducerentur, et filii qui hodie boni ac mali ignorant distantiam, ipsi ingredientur: et ipsis dabo Terram, et possidebunt eam.

verses.textEn: But as for you, turn back and go out to the wilderness, by way of the Red Sea.’
verses.textLa: Vos autem revertimini et abite in solitudinem per viam Maris Rubri.

verses.textEn: And you responded to me: ‘We have sinned against the Lord. We will ascend and fight, just as the Lord our God has instructed.’ And having been equipped with weapons, when you were setting out for the mountain,
verses.textLa: Et respondistis mihi: Peccavimus Domino: ascendemus et pugnabimus, sicut præcepit Dominus Deus noster. Cumque instructi armis pergeretis in montem,

verses.textEn: the Lord said to me: ‘Say to them: Do not ascend and do not fight. For I am not with you. Otherwise, you may fall in the sight of your enemies.’
verses.textLa: ait mihi Dominus: Dic ad eos: Nolite ascendere, neque pugnetis, non enim sum vobiscum: ne cadatis coram inimicis vestris.

verses.textEn: I spoke, and you did not listen. But, opposing the order of the Lord, and swelling with pride, you ascended onto the mountain.
verses.textLa: Locutus sum, et non audistis: sed adversantes imperio Domini, et tumentes superbia ascendistis in montem.

verses.textEn: And so, having gone forth, the Amorite, who was living in the mountains, came against you and pursued you, just as a swarm of bees would do. And he struck you down from Seir all the way to Hormah.
verses.textLa: Itaque egressus Amorrhæus, qui habitabat in montibus, et obviam veniens persecutus est vos, sicut solent apes persequi: et cecidit de Seir usque Horma.

verses.textEn: And when you returned and were weeping in the sight of the Lord, he would not hear you, nor was he willing to agree to your voice.
verses.textLa: Cumque reversi ploraretis coram Domino, non audivit vos, nec voci vestræ voluit acquiescere.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you camped at Kadesh-barnea for a long time.”
verses.textLa: Sedistis ergo in Cadesbarne multo tempore.

verses.textEn: “And setting out from there, we arrived at the wilderness which leads to the Red Sea, just as the Lord had spoken to me. And we encompassed Mount Seir for a long time.
verses.textLa: Profectique inde venimus in solitudinem, quæ ducit ad Mare Rubrum, sicut mihi dixerat Dominus: et circuivimus montem Seir longo tempore.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to me:
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad me:

verses.textEn: ‘You have encompassed this mountain for long enough. Go forth, toward the north.
verses.textLa: Sufficit vobis circuire montem istum: ite contra Aquilonem:

verses.textEn: And instruct the people, saying: You shall cross through the borders of your brothers, the sons of Esau, who live at Seir, and they will fear you.
verses.textLa: et populo præcipe, dicens: Transibitis per terminos fratrum vestrorum filiorum Esau, qui habitant in Seir, et timebunt vos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, take care diligently, lest you be moved against them. For I will not give to you from their land even as much as the step that one foot can tread upon, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession.
verses.textLa: Videte ergo diligenter ne moveamini contra eos. Neque enim dabo vobis de terra eorum quantum potest unius pedis calcare vestigium, quia in possessionem Esau dedi montem Seir.

verses.textEn: You shall buy food from them for money, and you shall eat. You shall draw water for money, and you shall drink.
verses.textLa: Cibos emetis ab eis pecunia, et comedetis: aquam emptam haurietis, et bibetis.

verses.textEn: The Lord your God has blessed you in every work of your hands. The Lord your God, dwelling with you, knows your journey, how you crossed through this great wilderness over forty years, and how you have been lacking in nothing.’
verses.textLa: Dominus Deus tuus benedixit tibi in omni opere manuum tuarum: novit iter tuum, quomodo transieris solitudinem hanc magnam, per quadraginta annos habitans tecum Dominus Deus tuus, et nihil tibi defuit.

verses.textEn: And when we had passed through our brothers, the sons of Esau, who were living at Seir by the way of the plain from Elath and from Eziongeber, we arrived at the way which leads to the desert of Moab.
verses.textLa: Cumque transissemus fratres nostros filios Esau, qui habitabant in Seir, per viam campestrem de Elath, et de Asiongaber, venimus ad iter, quod ducit in desertum Moab.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to me: ‘You should not fight against the Moabites, nor should you go to battle against them. For I will not give to you anything from their land, because I have given Ar to the sons of Lot as a possession.’
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad me: Non pugnes contra Moabitas, nec ineas adversus eos prælium: non enim dabo tibi quidquam de terra eorum, quia filiis Loth tradidi Ar in possessionem.

verses.textEn: The Emim were the first of its inhabitants, a people great and strong, and of such great height, like the race of the Anakim.
verses.textLa: Emim primi fuerunt habitatores eius, populus magnus, et validus, et tam excelsus ut de Enacim stirpe,

verses.textEn: They were considered to be like giants, and they were like the sons of the Anakim. And, indeed, the Moabites call them: the Emim.
verses.textLa: quasi gigantes crederentur, et essent similes filiorum Enacim. Denique Moabitæ appellant eos Emim.

verses.textEn: The Horites also formerly lived at Seir. When these had been driven out and destroyed, the sons of Esau lived there, just as Israel did in the land of his possession, which the Lord gave to him.
verses.textLa: In Seir autem prius habitaverunt Horrhæi: quibus expulsis atque deletis, habitaverunt filii Esau, sicut fecit Israel in terra possessionis suæ, quam dedit illi Dominus.

verses.textEn: Then, rising up so as to cross over the torrent Zered, we arrived at the place.
verses.textLa: Surgentes ergo ut transiremus Torrentem Zared, venimus ad eum.

verses.textEn: Then, from the time that we advanced from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed over the torrent Zered, there were thirty-eight years, until the entire generation of the men who were fit for war had been consumed out of the camp, just as the Lord had sworn.
verses.textLa: Tempus autem, quo ambulavimus de Cadesbarne usque ad transitum torrentis Zared, triginta et octo annorum fuit: donec consumeretur omnis generatio hominum bellatorum de castris, sicut iuraverat Dominus:

verses.textEn: For his hand was against them, so that they would pass away from the midst of the camp.
verses.textLa: cuius manus fuit adversum eos, ut interirent de castrorum medio.

verses.textEn: Then, after all the fighting men had fallen,
verses.textLa: Postquam autem universi ceciderunt pugnatores,

verses.textEn: the Lord spoke to me, saying:
verses.textLa: locutus est Dominus ad me, dicens:

verses.textEn: ‘Today, you shall cross the borders of Moab, at the city named Ar.
verses.textLa: Tu transibis hodie terminos Moab, urbem nomine Ar:

verses.textEn: And when you have arrived in the vicinity of the sons of Ammon, be careful that you do not fight against them, nor should you be moved to battle. For I will not give to you from the land of the sons of Ammon, because I have given it to the sons of Lot as a possession.’
verses.textLa: et accedens in vicina filiorum Ammon, cave ne pugnes contra eos, nec movearis ad prælium: non enim dabo tibi de terra filiorum Ammon, quia filiis Loth dedi eam in possessionem.

verses.textEn: It was reputed to be a land of giants. And giants lived there in times past, those whom the Ammonites call the Zamzummim.
verses.textLa: Terra gigantum reputata est: et in ipsa olim habitaverunt gigantes, quos Ammonitæ vocant Zomzommim,

verses.textEn: They are a people, great and numerous, and of lofty stature, like the Anakim, whom the Lord wiped away before their face. And he caused them to live there in place of them,
verses.textLa: populus magnus, et multus, et proceræ longitudinis, sicut Enacim, quos delevit Dominus a facie eorum: et fecit illos habitare pro eis,

verses.textEn: just as he had done for the sons of Esau, who live at Seir, wiping out the Horites and delivering their land to them, which they possess even to the present time.
verses.textLa: sicut fecerat filiis Esau, qui habitant in Seir, delens Horrhæos, et terram eorum illis tradens, quam possident usque in præsens.

verses.textEn: Likewise the Hevites, who were living in small villages as far as Gaza, were expelled by the Cappadocians, who went forth from Cappadocia, and they wiped them out and lived in their place.
verses.textLa: Hevæos quoque, qui habitabant in Haserim usque Gazan, Cappadoces expulerunt: qui egressi de Cappadocia deleverunt eos, et habitaverunt pro illis.

verses.textEn: ‘Rise up and cross the torrent Arnon! Behold, I have delivered Sihon, the king of Heshbon, the Amorite, into your hand, and so, begin to possess his land and to engage in battle against him.
verses.textLa: Surgite, et transite torrentem Arnon: ecce tradidi in manu tua Sehon regem Hesebon Amorrhæum, et terram eius incipe possidere, et committe adversus eum prælium.

verses.textEn: Today I will begin to send the terror and dread of you among the peoples who are living under all of heaven, so that, when they hear your name, they may be afraid, and may tremble in the manner of a woman giving birth, and may be gripped by anguish.’
verses.textLa: Hodie incipiam mittere terrorem atque formidinem tuam in populos, qui habitant sub omni cælo: ut audito nomine tuo paveant, et in morem parturientium contremiscant, et dolore teneantur.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon, the king of Heshbon, with peaceful words, saying:
verses.textLa: Misi ergo nuncios de solitudine Cademoth ad Sehon regem Hesebon verbis pacificis, dicens:

verses.textEn: ‘We will cross through your land. We will advance by the public way. We will not turn aside, neither to the right, nor to the left.
verses.textLa: Transibimus per terram tuam, publica gradiemur via: non declinabimus neque ad dexteram, neque ad sinistram.

verses.textEn: Sell us food for a price, so that we may eat. Provide us with water for money, and so we will drink. We only ask that you allow us to pass through,
verses.textLa: Alimenta pretio vende nobis, ut vescamur: aquam pecunia tribue, et sic bibemus. Tantum est ut nobis concedas transitum,

verses.textEn: just as the sons of Esau have done, who live at Seir, and the Moabites, who abide in Ar, until we arrive at the Jordan, and we cross to the land which the Lord our God will give to us.’
verses.textLa: sicut fecerunt filii Esau, qui habitant in Seir, et Moabitæ, qui morantur in Ar: donec veniamus ad Iordanem, et transeamus ad Terram, quam Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.

verses.textEn: And Sihon, the king of Heshbon, was not willing to grant passage to us. For the Lord your God had hardened his spirit, and had fastened his heart, so that he would be delivered into your hands, just as you now see.
verses.textLa: Noluitque Sehon rex Hesebon dare nobis transitum: quia induraverat Dominus Deus tuus spiritum eius, et obfirmaverat cor illius, ut traderetur in manus tuas, sicut nunc vides.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to me: ‘Behold, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his land to you. Begin to possess it.’
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad me: Ecce cœpi tibi tradere Sehon, et terram eius, incipe possidere eam.

verses.textEn: And Sihon went out to meet us with all his people, to battle at Jahaz.
verses.textLa: Egressusque est Sehon obviam nobis cum omni populo suo ad prælium in Iasa.

verses.textEn: And the Lord our God delivered him to us. And we struck him down, with his sons and all his people.
verses.textLa: Et tradidit eum Dominus Deus noster nobis: percussimusque eum cum filiis suis et omni populo suo.

verses.textEn: And we seized all his cities at that time, putting to death their inhabitants: men as well as women and children. We left nothing of them,
verses.textLa: Cunctasque urbes in tempore illo cepimus, interfectis habitatoribus earum, viris ac mulieribus et parvulis. Non reliquimus in eis quidquam.

verses.textEn: except the cattle, which went to the share of those who plundered them. And we seized the spoils of the cities,
verses.textLa: Absque iumentis, quæ in partem venere prædantium: et spoliis urbium, quas cepimus

verses.textEn: from Aroer, which is above the bank of the torrent Arnon, a town which is situated in a valley, all the way to Gilead. There was not a village or city which escaped from our hands. The Lord our God delivered everything to us,
verses.textLa: ab Aroer, quæ est super ripam torrentis Arnon, oppido quod in valle situm est, usque Galaad. Non fuit vicus et civitas, quæ nostras effugeret manus: omnes tradidit Dominus Deus noster nobis.

verses.textEn: except the land of the sons of Ammon, which we did not approach, and all that is adjacent to the torrent Jabbok, and the cities in the mountains, and all the places which the Lord our God prohibited to us.”
verses.textLa: Absque terra filiorum Ammon, ad quam non accessimus: et cunctis quæ adiacent torrenti Ieboc, et urbibus montanis, universisque locis, a quibus nos prohibuit Dominus Deus noster.

verses.textEn: “And so, having turned back, we ascended by the way of Bashan. And Og, the king of Bashan, went forth with his people to meet us in warfare at Edrei.
verses.textLa: Itaque conversi ascendimus per iter Basan: egressusque est Og rex Basan in occursum nobis cum populo suo ad bellandum in Edrai.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to me: ‘You should not fear him. For he has been delivered into your hand, with all his people as well as his land. And you shall do to him just as you have done to Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.’
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad me: Ne timeas eum: quia in manu tua traditus est cum omni populo ac terra sua: faciesque ei sicut fecisti Sehon regi Amorrhæorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Lord our God delivered into our hands, now Og, the king of Bashan, and all his people. And we struck them down unto utter annihilation,
verses.textLa: Tradidit ergo Dominus Deus noster in manibus nostris etiam Og regem Basan, et universum populum eius: percussimusque eos usque ad internecionem,

verses.textEn: laying waste to all his cities at one time. There was not a village which escaped from us: sixty cities, the entire region of Argob, the kingdom of Og, in Bashan.
verses.textLa: vastantes cunctas civitates illius uno tempore. Non fuit oppidum, quod nos effugeret: sexaginta urbes, omnem regionem Argob regni Og in Basan.

verses.textEn: All the cities were fortified with very high walls, and with gates and bars, in addition to innumerable villages which had no walls.
verses.textLa: Cunctæ urbes erant munitæ muris altissimis, portisque et vectibus, absque oppidis innumeris, quæ non habebant muros.

verses.textEn: And we wiped them out, just as we had done to Sihon, the king of Heshbon, destroying every city, and its men, as well as women and children.
verses.textLa: Et delevimus eos, sicut feceramus Sehon regi Hesebon, disperdentes omnem civitatem, virosque ac mulieres et parvulos:

verses.textEn: But the cattle and the spoils of the cities, we plundered.
verses.textLa: iumenta autem et spolia urbium diripuimus.

verses.textEn: And at that time, we took the land from the hand of the two kings of the Amorites, who were across the Jordan: from the torrent Arnon as far as Mount Hermon,
verses.textLa: Tulimusque illo in tempore terram de manu duorum regum Amorrhæorum, qui erant trans Iordanem: a torrente Arnon usque ad montem Hernon,

verses.textEn: which the Sidonians call Sirion, and the Amorites call Senir,
verses.textLa: quem Sidonii Sarion vocant, et Amorrhæi Sanir:

verses.textEn: all the cities that are situated in the plain, and the entire land of Gilead and Bashan, all the way to Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.textLa: omnes civitates, quæ sitæ sunt in planitie, et universam Terram Galaad et Basan usque ad Selcha, et Edrai civitates regni Og in Basan.

verses.textEn: For only Og, the king of Bashan, was left behind out of the race of the giants. His bed of iron is on display, (it is in Rabbah, among the sons of Ammon) being nine cubits in length, and four in width, according to the measure of the cubit of a man’s hand.
verses.textLa: Solus quippe Og rex Basan restiterat de stirpe gigantum. Monstratur lectus eius ferreus, qui est in Rabbath filiorum Ammon, novem cubitos habens longitudinis, et quattuor latitudinis ad mensuram cubiti virilis manus.

verses.textEn: And we possessed the land, at that time, from Aroer, which is above the bank of the torrent Arnon, as far as the middle of Mount Gilead. And I gave its cities to Ruben and Gad.
verses.textLa: Terramque possedimus tempore illo ab Aroer, quæ est super ripam torrentis Arnon, usque ad mediam partem montis Galaad: et civitates illius dedi Ruben et Gad.

verses.textEn: Then I delivered the remaining part of Gilead, and all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og, which is the entire region of Argob, to one half of the tribe of Manasseh. And all of Bashan is called the land of the giants.
verses.textLa: Reliquam autem partem Galaad, et omnem Basan regni Og, tradidi mediæ tribui Manasse, omnem regionem Argob: cunctaque Basan vocatur terra gigantum.

verses.textEn: Jair, the son of Manasseh, possessed all the region of Argob, as far as the borders of Geshur and Maacath. And he called Bashan by his own name, Havvoth Jair, that is, the villages of Jair, even to the present day.
verses.textLa: Iair filius Manasse possedit omnem regionem Argob usque ad terminos Gessuri, et Machati. Vocavitque ex nomine suo Basan, Havoth Iair, id est, Villas Iair, usque in præsentem diem.

verses.textEn: Likewise, to Machir, I gave Gilead.
verses.textLa: Machir quoque dedi Galaad.

verses.textEn: And to the tribes of Ruben and Gad, I gave from the land of Gilead as far as the torrent Arnon, one half of the torrent and its confines, even to the torrent Jabbok, which is along the border of the sons of Ammon,
verses.textLa: Et tribubus Ruben et Gad dedi de Terra Galaad usque ad Torrentem Arnon medium torrentis, et confinium usque ad torrentem Ieboc, qui est terminus filiorum Ammon:

verses.textEn: and the plain of the wilderness, as well as the Jordan, and the borders of Chinnereth, all the way to the sea of the desert, which is very salty, to the base of Mount Pisgah toward the east.
verses.textLa: et planitiem solitudinis, atque Iordanem, et terminos Cenereth usque ad mare deserti, quod est salsissimum, ad radices montis Phasga contra orientem.

verses.textEn: And I instructed you at that time, saying: ‘The Lord your God gives to you this land as an inheritance. Having armed yourselves, go before your brothers, the sons of Israel, all you strong men.
verses.textLa: Præcepique vobis in tempore illo, dicens: Dominus Deus vester dat vobis terram hanc in hereditatem: expediti præcedite fratres vestros filios Israel omnes viri robusti:

verses.textEn: Leave behind your wives and little ones, as well as the cattle. For I know that you have many cattle, and they should remain in the cities which I have delivered to you,
verses.textLa: absque uxoribus, et parvulis atque iumentis. Novi enim quod plura habeatis pecora, et in urbibus remanere debebunt, quas tradidi vobis,

verses.textEn: until the Lord provides rest to your brothers, just as he has provided for you. And they, too, shall possess the land, which he will give to them beyond the Jordan. Then each one shall return to his possession, which I have allotted to you.’
verses.textLa: donec requiem tribuat Dominus fratribus vestris, sicut vobis tribuit: et possideant ipsi etiam Terram, quam daturus est eis trans Iordanem: tunc revertetur unusquisque in possessionem suam, quam dedi vobis.

verses.textEn: Likewise, I instructed Joshua at that time, saying: ‘Your eyes have seen what the Lord your God has done to these two kings. So also will he do to all the kingdoms through which you shall pass.
verses.textLa: Iosue quoque in tempore illo præcepi, dicens: Oculi tui viderunt quæ fecit Dominus Deus vester duobus his regibus: sic faciet omnibus regnis, ad quæ transiturus es.

verses.textEn: You should not fear them. For the Lord your God will fight on your behalf.’
verses.textLa: Ne timeas eos: Dominus enim Deus vester pugnabit pro vobis.

verses.textEn: And I beseeched the Lord at that time, saying:
verses.textLa: Precatusque sum Dominum in tempore illo, dicens:

verses.textEn: ‘Lord God, you have begun to reveal your greatness and your very strong hand to your servant. For there is no other god, either in heaven or on earth, who is able to accomplish your works, or to be compared to your strength.
verses.textLa: Domine Deus tu cœpisti ostendere servo tuo magnitudinem tuam, manumque fortissimam. Neque enim est alius deus vel in cælo, vel in terra, qui possit facere opera tua, et comparari fortitudini tuæ.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I will cross over, and I will view this excellent land beyond the Jordan, and this singular mountain, and Lebanon.’
verses.textLa: Transibo igitur, et videbo Terram hanc optimam trans Iordanem, et montem istum egregium, et Libanum.

verses.textEn: And the Lord became angry with me because of you, and he would not heed me. But he said to me: ‘It is enough for you. You shall no longer speak to me at all about this matter.
verses.textLa: Iratusque est Dominus mihi propter vos, nec exaudivit me, sed dixit mihi: Sufficit tibi: nequaquam ultra loquaris de hac re ad me.

verses.textEn: Ascend to the summit of Pisgah, and look around with your eyes to the west, and to the north, and to the south, and to the east, and behold it. For you shall not cross this Jordan.
verses.textLa: Ascende cacumen Phasgæ, et oculos tuos circumfer ad occidentem, et ad aquilonem, austrumque et orientem, et aspice. Nec enim transibis Iordanem istum.

verses.textEn: Instruct Joshua, and encourage and strengthen him. For he shall go before this people, and he shall distribute to them the land that you will see.’
verses.textLa: Præcipe Iosue, et corrobora eum atque conforta: quia ipse præcedet populum istum, et dividet eis Terram, quam visurus es.

verses.textEn: And we remained in the valley, opposite the shrine of Peor.”
verses.textLa: Mansimusque in valle contra fanum Phogor.

verses.textEn: “And now, O Israel, listen to the precepts and judgments which I am teaching to you, so that, by doing these, you may live, and you may enter and possess the land, which the Lord, the God of your fathers, will give to you.
verses.textLa: Et nunc Israel audi præcepta et iudicia, quæ ego doceo te: ut faciens ea, vivas, et ingrediens possideas Terram, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum daturus est vobis.

verses.textEn: You shall not add to the word which I speak to you, neither shall you take away from it. Preserve the commandments of the Lord your God which I am teaching to you.
verses.textLa: Non addetis ad verbum, quod vobis loquor, nec auferetis ex eo: custodite mandata Domini Dei vestri quæ ego præcipio vobis.

verses.textEn: Your eyes have seen all that the Lord has done against Baal-peor, in what manner he has crushed all of his worshippers from among you.
verses.textLa: Oculi vestri viderunt omnia quæ fecit Dominus contra Beelphegor, quomodo contriverit omnes cultores eius de medio vestri.

verses.textEn: But you who adhere to the Lord your God are all still alive, to the present day.
verses.textLa: Vos autem qui adhæretis Domino Deo vestro, vivitis universi usque in præsentem diem.

verses.textEn: You know that I have taught you precepts as well as justices, just as the Lord my God has commanded me. And so shall you do in the land that you will possess.
verses.textLa: Scitis quod docuerim vos præcepta atque iustitias, sicut mandavit mihi Dominus Deus meus: sic facietis ea in Terra, quam possessuri estis:

verses.textEn: And you shall observe and fulfill these in practice. For this is your wisdom and understanding in the sight of the peoples, so that, upon hearing all these precepts, they may say: ‘Lo, a wise and understanding people, a great nation.’
verses.textLa: et observabitis et implebitis opere. Hæc est enim vestra sapientia, et intellectus coram populis, ut audientes universa præcepta hæc, dicant: En populus sapiens et intelligens, gens magna.

verses.textEn: Neither is there any other nation so great, which has its gods so near to them, as our God is present to all our petitions.
verses.textLa: Nec est alia natio tam grandis, quæ habeat deos appropinquantes sibi, sicut Deus noster adest cunctis obsecrationibus nostris.

verses.textEn: For what other nation is there so renowned as to have ceremonies, and just judgments, and the entire law that I will set forth today before your eyes?
verses.textLa: Quæ est enim alia gens sic inclyta ut habeat ceremonias, iustaque iudicia, et universam legem, quam ego proponam hodie ante oculos vestros?

verses.textEn: And so, guard yourself and your soul carefully. You should not forget the words that your eyes have seen, and do not let them be cut away from your heart, throughout all the days of your life. You shall teach them to your sons and to your grandsons,
verses.textLa: Custodi igitur temetipsum, et animam tuam solicite. Ne obliviscaris verborum, quæ viderunt oculi tui, et ne excidant de corde tuo cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ. Docebis ea filios ac nepotes tuos,

verses.textEn: from the day on which you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, when the Lord spoke to me, saying: ‘Gather the people to me, so that they may listen to my words, and may learn to fear me, throughout all the time that they are alive on earth, and so that they may teach their children.’
verses.textLa: a die in quo stetisti coram Domino Deo tuo in Horeb, quando Dominus locutus est mihi dicens: Congrega ad me populum, ut audiant sermones meos, et discant timere me omni tempore quo vivunt in terra, doceantque filios suos.

verses.textEn: And you approached the base of the mountain, which was burning even toward heaven. And there was a darkness upon it, and a cloud, and a mist.
verses.textLa: Et accessistis ad radices montis, qui ardebat usque ad cælum: erantque in eo tenebræ, et nubes, et caligo.
verses.notes: Here is a good example of a common translation dilemma. The word ‘caligo’ is often translated as ‘darkness’ or as ‘fog/mist’, but ‘tenebrae’ meaning darkness, and ‘nubes’ meaning cloud, are already used in this list of three terms. So the translator cannot use ‘darkness’, and the terms ‘fog’ and ‘mist’ are rather close to ‘cloud.’ In this case, caligo can be translated as fog or mist, despite the closeness in meaning to cloud. In other contexts, caligo is translated as darkness.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to you from the midst of fire. You heard the voice of his words, but you did not see any form at all.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad vos de medio ignis. Vocem verborum eius audistis, et formam penitus non vidistis.

verses.textEn: And he revealed his covenant to you, which he instructed you to carry out, and the ten words which he wrote on two tablets of stone.
verses.textLa: Et ostendit vobis pactum suum, quod præcepit ut faceretis, et decem verba, quæ scripsit in duabus tabulis lapideis.

verses.textEn: And he commanded me, at that time, that I should teach you the ceremonies and judgments which you must carry out, in the land that you shall possess.
verses.textLa: Mihique mandavit in illo tempore ut docerem vos ceremonias et iudicia, quæ facere deberetis in Terra, quam possessuri estis.

verses.textEn: And so, guard your souls carefully. You saw no likeness on the day that the Lord God spoke to you on Horeb from the midst of fire.
verses.textLa: Custodite igitur solicite animas vestras. Non vidistis aliquam similitudinem in die, qua locutus est vobis Dominus in Horeb de medio ignis:

verses.textEn: Otherwise, perhaps being deceived, you might have made a graven image, or an image of male or female,
verses.textLa: ne forte decepti faciatis vobis sculptam similitudinem, aut imaginem masculi vel feminæ,

verses.textEn: a likeness of any of the beasts, which are upon the earth, or of birds, which fly under heaven,
verses.textLa: similitudinem omnium iumentorum, quæ sunt super terram, vel avium sub cælo volantium,

verses.textEn: or of reptiles, which move across the earth, or of fish, which abide in the waters under the earth.
verses.textLa: atque reptilium, quæ moventur in terra, sive piscium qui sub terra morantur in aquis:

verses.textEn: Otherwise, perhaps lifting up your eyes to heaven, you might look upon the sun and the moon and all the stars of heaven, and being deceived by error, you might adore and worship these things, which the Lord your God created for the service of all the nations, which are under heaven.
verses.textLa: ne forte elevatis oculis ad cælum, videas Solem et Lunam, et omnia astra cæli, et errore deceptus adores ea et colas quæ creavit Dominus Deus tuus in ministerium cunctis gentibus, quæ sub cælo sunt.

verses.textEn: But the Lord has taken you up, and led you away from the iron furnaces of Egypt, in order to have a people of inheritance, just as it is to the present day.
verses.textLa: Vos autem tulit Dominus, et eduxit de fornace ferrea Ægypti, ut haberet populum hereditarium, sicut est in præsenti die.

verses.textEn: And the Lord became angry against me because of your words, and he swore that I would not cross over the Jordan, nor enter into the excellent land, which he will give to you.
verses.textLa: Iratusque est Dominus contra me propter sermones vestros, et iuravit ut non transirem Iordanem, nec ingrederer Terram optimam, quam daturus est vobis.

verses.textEn: Behold, I shall die on this soil. I shall not cross over the Jordan. You shall cross it, and you shall possess the singular land.
verses.textLa: Ecce morior in hac humo, non transibo Iordanem: vos transibitis, et possidebitis terram egregiam.

verses.textEn: Be careful, lest you at some time forget the covenant of the Lord your God, which he has formed with you, and lest you make for yourselves a graven likeness of those things which the Lord has prohibited to be made.
verses.textLa: Cave ne quando obliviscaris pacti Domini Dei tui, quod pepigit tecum: et facias tibi sculptam similitudinem eorum, quæ fieri Dominus prohibuit:

verses.textEn: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
verses.textLa: quia Dominus Deus tuus ignis consumens est, Deus æmulator.

verses.textEn: When you will have conceived sons and grandsons while abiding in the land, and if, having been deceived, you make for yourselves any likeness, accomplishing evil in the sight of the Lord your God, so as to provoke him to wrath,
verses.textLa: Si genueritis filios ac nepotes, et morati fueritis in Terra, deceptique feceritis vobis aliquam similitudinem, patrantes malum coram Domino Deo vestro, ut eum ad iracundiam provocetis:

verses.textEn: I call heaven and earth as witnesses this day, that you shall quickly perish from the land, which, when you have crossed over the Jordan, you will possess. You will not live in it for a long time; instead, the Lord will destroy you.
verses.textLa: testes invoco hodie cælum et terram, cito perituros vos esse de Terra, quam transito Iordane possessuri estis. Non habitabitis in ea longo tempore, sed delebit vos Dominus,

verses.textEn: And he will scatter you among all the nations, and few of you will remain among those nations, to which the Lord will lead you.
verses.textLa: atque disperget in omnes gentes, et remanebitis pauci in nationibus, ad quas vos ducturus est Dominus.

verses.textEn: And there, you will serve gods which were fabricated by the hands of men: gods of wood and of stone, who neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
verses.textLa: Ibique servietis diis, qui hominum manu fabricati sunt, ligno et lapidi qui non vident, nec audiunt, nec comedunt, nec odorantur.

verses.textEn: And when you will seek the Lord your God in that place, you shall find him, if only you seek him with all your heart, and in all the tribulation of your soul.
verses.textLa: Cumque quæsieris ibi Dominum Deum tuum, invenies eum: si tamen toto corde quæsieris, et tota tribulatione animæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: After all these things which have been foretold have found you, in the end time, you shall return to the Lord your God, and you will hear his voice.
verses.textLa: Postquam te invenerint omnia quæ prædicta sunt, novissimo tempore reverteris ad Dominum Deum tuum, et audies vocem eius.

verses.textEn: For the Lord your God is a merciful God. He will not abandon you, nor will he entirely destroy you, nor will he forget the covenant, which he swore to your fathers.
verses.textLa: Quia Deus misericors Dominus Deus tuus est: non dimittet te, nec omnino delebit, neque obliviscetur pacti, in quo iuravit patribus tuis.

verses.textEn: Inquire concerning the days of antiquity, which were before you, from the day when God created man upon the earth, from one end of heaven to another, if anything similar has ever occurred, or whether any such thing has ever been known,
verses.textLa: Interroga de diebus antiquis, qui fuerunt ante te ex die quo creavit Deus hominem super terram, a summo cælo usque ad summum eius, si facta est aliquando huiuscemodi res, aut umquam cognitum est,

verses.textEn: that a people would hear the voice of God, speaking from the midst of fire, just as you have heard it, and live,
verses.textLa: ut audiret populus vocem Dei loquentis de medio ignis, sicut tu audisti, et vixisti:

verses.textEn: whether God has acted so as to enter and take for himself a nation from the midst of the nations, by means of tests, signs, and wonders, by means of fighting, and a strong hand, and an outstretched arm, and terrible visions, in accord with all the things which the Lord your God has accomplished for you in Egypt, in the sight of your eyes.
verses.textLa: si fecit Deus ut ingrederetur, et tolleret sibi gentem de medio nationum, per tentationes, signa, atque portenta, per pugnam, et robustam manum, extentumque brachium, et horribiles visiones iuxta omnia, quæ fecit pro vobis Dominus Deus vester in Ægypto, videntibus oculis tuis:

verses.textEn: So may you know that the Lord himself is God, and there is no other beside him.
verses.textLa: ut scires quoniam Dominus ipse est Deus, et non est alius præter eum.

verses.textEn: He has caused you to hear his voice from heaven, so that he might teach you. And he showed you his exceedingly great fire on earth, and you heard his words from the midst of the fire.
verses.textLa: De cælo te fecit audire vocem suam, ut doceret te, et in terra ostendit tibi ignem suum maximum, et audisti verba illius de medio ignis,

verses.textEn: For he loved your fathers, and he chose their offspring after them. And he led you away from Egypt, advancing before you with his great power,
verses.textLa: quia dilexit patres tuos, et elegit semen eorum post eos. Eduxitque te præcedens in virtute sua magna ex Ægypto,

verses.textEn: so as to wipe away, upon your arrival, nations, very great and stronger than you, and so as to lead you in, and to present to you their land as a possession, just as you discern in the present day.
verses.textLa: ut deleret nationes maximas et fortiores te in introitu tuo: et introduceret te, daretque tibi terram earum in possessionem, sicut cernis in præsenti die.

verses.textEn: Therefore, know on this day and consider in your heart, that the Lord himself is God in heaven above, and on earth below, and there is no other.
verses.textLa: Scito ergo hodie, et cogitato in corde tuo quod Dominus ipse sit Deus in cælo sursum, et in terra deorsum, et non sit alius.

verses.textEn: Keep his precepts and commandments, which I am teaching to you, so that it may be well with you, and with your sons after you, and so that you may remain for a long time upon the land, which the Lord your God will give to you.”
verses.textLa: Custodi præcepta eius atque mandata, quæ ego præcipio tibi: ut bene sit tibi, et filiis tuis post te, et permaneas multo tempore super Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi.

verses.textEn: Then Moses set aside three cities, across the Jordan toward the eastern region,
verses.textLa: Tunc separavit Moyses tres civitates trans Iordanem ad Orientalem plagam,

verses.textEn: so that anyone might flee to these if he has killed his neighbor unwillingly, who was not his enemy a day or two earlier, and so that he would be able to escape to one of these cities:
verses.textLa: ut confugiat ad eas qui occiderit nolens proximum suum, nec sibi fuerit inimicus ante unum et alterum diem, et ad harum aliquam urbium possit evadere:

verses.textEn: Bezer in the wilderness, which is situated in the plains of the tribe of Ruben; and Ramoth in Gilead, which is in the tribe of Gad; and Golan in Bashan, which is in the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Bosor in solitudine, quæ sita est in terra campestri de tribu Ruben: et Ramoth in Galaad, quæ est in tribu Gad: et Golan in Basan, quæ est in tribu Manasse.

verses.textEn: This is the law, which Moses set forth before the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Ista est lex, quam proposuit Moyses coram filiis Israel,

verses.textEn: And these are the testimonies and ceremonies as well as judgments, which he spoke to the sons of Israel, when they departed from Egypt,
verses.textLa: et hæc testimonia et ceremoniæ atque iudicia, quæ locutus est ad filios Israel, quando egressi sunt de Ægypto,

verses.textEn: across the Jordan, in the valley opposite the shrine of Peor, in the land of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses struck down. Accordingly, the sons of Israel, having departed from Egypt,
verses.textLa: trans Iordanem in valle contra fanum Phogor in terra Sehon regis Amorrhæi, qui habitavit in Hesebon, quem percussit Moyses. Filii quoque Israel egressi ex Ægypto

verses.textEn: possessed his land, and the land of Og, the king of Bashan, the land of the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun:
verses.textLa: possederunt terram eius, et terram Og regis Basan, duorum regum Amorrhæorum, qui erant trans Iordanem ad solis ortum:

verses.textEn: from Aroer, which is situated above the bank of the torrent Arnon, as far as Mount Zion, which is also called Hermon,
verses.textLa: Ab Aroer, quæ sita est super ripam torrentis Arnon, usque ad montem Sion, qui est et Hermon,

verses.textEn: the entire plain across the Jordan, from its eastern region, as far as the sea of the wilderness, and even to the base of Mount Pisgah.
verses.textLa: omnem planitiem trans Iordanem ad Orientalem plagam, usque ad mare solitudinis, et usque ad radices montis Phasga.

verses.textEn: And Moses summoned all of Israel, and he said to them: “Listen, O Israel, to the ceremonies and judgments, which I am speaking to your ears on this day. Learn them, and fulfill them in deed.
verses.textLa: Vocavitque Moyses omnem Israelem, et dixit ad eum: Audi Israel ceremonias atque iudicia, quæ ego loquor in auribus vestris hodie: discite ea, et opere complete.

verses.textEn: The Lord our God formed a covenant with us at Horeb.
verses.textLa: Dominus Deus noster pepigit nobiscum fœdus in Horeb.

verses.textEn: He did not make the covenant with our fathers, but with us, who are alive and in the present time.
verses.textLa: Non cum patribus nostris iniit pactum, sed nobiscum qui in præsentiarum sumus, et vivimus.

verses.textEn: He spoke to us face to face on the mountain, from the midst of fire.
verses.textLa: Facie ad faciem locutus est nobis in monte de medio ignis.

verses.textEn: I was the mediator, for I was in the middle between the Lord and you, at that time, to announce his words to you. For you were afraid of the fire, and so you did not ascend to the mountain. And he said:
verses.textLa: Ego sequester et medius fui inter Dominum et vos in tempore illo, ut annunciarem vobis verba eius. Timuistis enim ignem, et non ascendistis in montem, et ait:

verses.textEn: ‘I am the Lord your God, who led you away from the land of Egypt, from the house of servitude.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus Deus tuus, qui eduxi te de Terra Ægypti de domo servitutis.

verses.textEn: You shall not have strange gods in my sight.
verses.textLa: Non habebis deos alienos in conspectu meo.

verses.textEn: You shall not make for yourself a graven image, nor the likeness of anything, which is in heaven above, or on earth below, or which abides in the waters under the earth.
verses.textLa: Non facies tibi sculptile, nec similitudinem omnium, quæ in cælo sunt desuper, et quæ in terra deorsum, et quæ versantur in aquis sub terra.

verses.textEn: You shall not adore and you shall not worship these things. For I am the Lord your God, a jealous God, repaying the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons to the third and fourth generation to those who hate me,
verses.textLa: Non adorabis ea, et non coles. Ego enim sum Dominus Deus tuus: Deus æmulator, reddens iniquitatem patrum super filios in tertiam et quartam generationem his qui oderunt me,

verses.textEn: and acting with mercy in thousands of ways to those who love me and keep my precepts.
verses.textLa: et faciens misericordiam in multa millia diligentibus me, et custodientibus præcepta mea.

verses.textEn: You shall not use the name of the Lord your God in vain. For he will not go unpunished who takes up his name over an unimportant matter.
verses.textLa: Non usurpabis nomen Domini Dei tui frustra: quia non erit impunitus qui super re vana nomen eius assumpserit.

verses.textEn: Observe the day of the Sabbath, so that you may sanctify it, just as the Lord your God has instructed you.
verses.textLa: Observa diem Sabbati, ut sanctifices eum, sicut præcepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus.

verses.textEn: For six days, you shall labor and do all your work.
verses.textLa: Sex diebus operaberis, et facies omnia opera tua.

verses.textEn: The seventh is the day of the Sabbath, that is, the rest of the Lord your God. You shall not do any work in it, nor shall your son, nor daughter, nor man servant, nor woman servant, nor ox, nor donkey, nor any of your cattle, nor the sojourner who is within your gates, so that your men and woman servants may rest, just as you do.
verses.textLa: Septimus dies Sabbati est, id est, requies Domini Dei tui. Non facies in eo quidquam operis tu, et filius tuus, et filia, servus et ancilla, et bos, et asinus, et omne iumentum tuum, et peregrinus qui est intra portas tuas: ut requiescat servus tuus, et ancilla tua, sicut et tu.

verses.textEn: Remember that you also were servants in Egypt, and the Lord your God led you away from that place with a strong hand and an outstretched arm. Because of this, he has instructed you so that you would observe the Sabbath day.
verses.textLa: Memento quod et ipse servieris in Ægypto, et eduxerit te inde Dominus Deus tuus in manu forti, et brachio extento. Idcirco præcepit tibi ut observares diem Sabbati.

verses.textEn: Honor your father and mother, just as the Lord your God has instructed you, so that you may live a long time, and so that it may be well with you in the land, which the Lord your God will give to you.
verses.textLa: Honora patrem tuum et matrem, sicut præcepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus, ut longo vivas tempore, et bene sit tibi in Terra, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi.

verses.textEn: You shall not murder.
verses.textLa: Non occides.

verses.textEn: And you shall not commit adultery.
verses.textLa: Neque mœchaberis.

verses.textEn: And you shall not commit theft.
verses.textLa: Furtumque non facies.

verses.textEn: Neither shall you speak false testimony against your neighbor.
verses.textLa: Nec loqueris contra proximum tuum falsum testimonium.

verses.textEn: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor his house, nor his field, nor his man servant, nor his woman servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything out of all that is his.’
verses.textLa: Non concupisces uxorem proximi tui: non domum, non agrum, non servum, non ancillam, non bovem, non asinum, et universa quæ illius sunt.

verses.textEn: The Lord spoke these words to the entire multitude of you on the mountain, from the midst of the fire and the cloud and the darkness, with a loud voice, adding nothing more. And he wrote them on two tablets of stone, which he delivered to me.
verses.textLa: Hæc verba locutus est Dominus ad omnem multitudinem vestram in monte de medio ignis et nubis, et caliginis, voce magna, nihil addens amplius: et scripsit ea in duabus tabulis lapideis, quas tradidit mihi.

verses.textEn: Then, after you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, and you saw the mountain burning, you approached me, all you leaders of the tribes and those greater by birth. And you said:
verses.textLa: Vos autem postquam audistis vocem de medio tenebrarum, et montem ardere vidistis, accessistis ad me omnes principes tribuum et maiores natu, atque dixistis:

verses.textEn: ‘Behold, the Lord our God has revealed to us his majesty and his greatness. We have heard his voice from the midst of fire, and we have proven today that, though God is speaking with man, man has lived.
verses.textLa: Ecce ostendit nobis Dominus Deus noster maiestatem et magnitudinem suam. Vocem eius audivimus de medio ignis, et probavimus hodie quod loquente Deo cum homine, vixerit homo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, why should we die, and why should this very great fire devour us? For if we hear the voice of the Lord our God any longer, we will die.
verses.textLa: Cur ergo moriemur, et devorabit nos ignis hic maximus? Si enim audierimus ultra vocem Domini Dei nostri, moriemur.

verses.textEn: What is all flesh, that it would hear the voice of the living God, who speaks from the midst of fire, just as we have heard it, and be able to live?
verses.textLa: Quid est omnis caro, ut audiat vocem Dei viventis, qui de medio ignis loquitur sicut nos audivimus, et possit vivere?

verses.textEn: Instead, you should approach and listen to all the things that the Lord our God will say to you. And you will speak to us, and we will listen and do these things.’
verses.textLa: Tu magis accede: et audi cuncta quæ dixerit Dominus Deus noster tibi: loquerisque ad nos, et nos audientes faciemus ea.

verses.textEn: But when the Lord had heard this, he said to me: ‘I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they spoke to you. All this, they have spoken well.
verses.textLa: Quod cum audisset Dominus, ait ad me: Audivi vocem verborum populi huius quæ locuti sunt tibi: bene omnia sunt locuti.

verses.textEn: Who will grant to them to have such a mind, so that they may fear me, and may keep all my commandments at all times, so that it may be well with them and with their sons forever?
verses.textLa: Quis det talem eos habere mentem, ut timeant me, et custodiant universa mandata mea in omni tempore, ut bene sit eis et filiis eorum in sempiternum?

verses.textEn: Go and say to them: Return to your tents.
verses.textLa: Vade et dic eis: Revertimini in tentoria vestra.

verses.textEn: But as for you, stand here with me, and I will speak to you all my commandments and ceremonies, as well as judgments. These, you shall teach them, so that they may do them in the land, which I will give to them as a possession.
verses.textLa: Tu vero hic sta mecum, et loquar tibi omnia mandata mea, et ceremonias atque iudicia: quæ docebis eos, ut faciant ea in Terra, quam dabo illis in possessionem.

verses.textEn: And so, keep and do the things which the Lord God has commanded you. You shall not turn aside, neither to the right, nor to the left.
verses.textLa: Custodite igitur et facite quæ præcepit Dominus Deus vobis: non declinabitis neque ad dexteram, neque ad sinistram:

verses.textEn: For you shall walk in the way that the Lord your God has instructed, so that you may live, and it may be well with you, and your days may be extended in the land of your possession.’ ”
verses.textLa: sed per viam, quam præcepit Dominus Deus vester, ambulabitis, ut vivatis, et bene sit vobis, et protelentur dies in terra possessionis vestræ.

verses.textEn: “These are the precepts and ceremonies, as well as the judgments, which the Lord your God has commanded that I teach to you, which you shall do in the land to which you will travel in order to possess it.
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt præcepta, et ceremoniæ, atque iudicia, quæ mandavit Dominus Deus vester ut docerem vos, et faciatis ea in Terra, ad quam transgredimini possidendam:

verses.textEn: So may you fear the Lord your God, and keep all his commandments and precepts, which I am entrusting to you, and to your sons and grandsons, all the days of your life, so that your days may be prolonged.
verses.textLa: ut timeas Dominum Deum tuum, et custodias omnia mandata et præcepta eius, quæ ego præcipio tibi, et filiis, ac nepotibus tuis, cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ, ut prolongentur dies tui.

verses.textEn: Listen and observe, O Israel, so that you may do just as the Lord has instructed you, and it may be well with you, and you may be multiplied all the more, for the Lord, the God of your fathers, has promised you a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.textLa: Audi Israel, et observa ut facias quæ præcepit tibi Dominus, et bene sit tibi, et multipliceris amplius, sicut pollicitus est Dominus Deus patrum tuorum tibi terram lacte et melle manantem.

verses.textEn: Listen, O Israel: the Lord our God is one Lord.
verses.textLa: Audi Israel, Dominus Deus noster, Dominus unus est.

verses.textEn: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength.
verses.textLa: Diliges Dominum Deum tuum ex toto corde tuo, et ex tota anima tua, et ex tota fortitudine tua.

verses.textEn: And these words, which I instruct to you this day, shall be in your heart.
verses.textLa: Eruntque verba hæc, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, in corde tuo:

verses.textEn: And you shall explain them to your sons. And you shall meditate upon them sitting in your house, and walking on a journey, when lying down and when rising up.
verses.textLa: et narrabis ea filiis tuis, et meditaberis in eis sedens in domo tua, et ambulans in itinere, dormiens atque consurgens.

verses.textEn: And you shall bind them like a sign on your hand, and they shall be placed and shall move between your eyes.
verses.textLa: Et ligabis ea quasi signum in manu tua, eruntque et movebuntur inter oculos tuos,

verses.textEn: And you shall write them at the threshold and on the doors of your house.
verses.textLa: scribesque ea in limine, et ostiis domus tuæ.

verses.textEn: And when the Lord your God will have led you into the land, about which he swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and when he will have given to you great and excellent cities, which you did not build;
verses.textLa: Cumque introduxerit te Dominus Deus tuus in Terram, pro qua iuravit patribus tuis Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob: et dederit tibi civitates magnas et optimas, quas non ædificasti,

verses.textEn: houses full of goods, which you did not amass; cisterns, which you did not dig; vineyards and olive groves, which you did not plant;
verses.textLa: domos plenas cunctarum opum, quas non extruxisti, cisternas, quas non fodisti, vineta et oliveta, quæ non plantasti,

verses.textEn: and when you will have eaten and been satisfied:
verses.textLa: et comederis, et saturatus fueris:

verses.textEn: take care diligently, lest you forget the Lord, who led you away from the land of Egypt, from the house of servitude. You shall fear the Lord your God, and you shall serve him alone, and you shall swear by his name.
verses.textLa: cave diligenter ne obliviscaris Domini, qui eduxit te de Terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis. Dominum Deum tuum timebis, et illi soli servies, ac per nomen illius iurabis.

verses.textEn: You shall not go after the strange gods of all the Gentiles, who are around you.
verses.textLa: Non ibitis post deos alienos cunctarum Gentium, quæ in circuitu vestro sunt:

verses.textEn: For the Lord your God is a jealous God in your midst. Otherwise, at some time, the fury of the Lord your God may be enraged against you, and he may take you away from the face of the earth.
verses.textLa: quoniam Deus æmulator Dominus Deus tuus in medio tui: nequando irascatur furor Domini Dei tui contra te, et auferat te de superficie terræ.

verses.textEn: You shall not tempt the Lord your God, as you tempted him in the place of temptation.
verses.textLa: Non tentabis Dominum Deum tuum, sicut tentasti in loco tentationis.

verses.textEn: Keep the precepts of the Lord your God, as well as the testimonies and ceremonies, which he has instructed to you.
verses.textLa: Custodi præcepta Domini Dei tui, ac testimonia et ceremonias, quas præcepit tibi:

verses.textEn: And do what is pleasing and good in the sight of the Lord, so that it may be well with you, and so that, when you enter, you may possess the excellent land, about which the Lord swore to your fathers
verses.textLa: et fac quod placitum est et bonum in conspectu Domini, ut bene sit tibi: et ingressus possideas terram optimam, de qua iuravit Dominus patribus tuis,

verses.textEn: that he would wipe away all your enemies before you, just as he has spoken.
verses.textLa: ut deleret omnes inimicos tuos coram te, sicut locutus est.

verses.textEn: And when your son will ask you tomorrow, saying: ‘What do these testimonies and ceremonies and judgments mean, which the Lord our God has entrusted to us?’
verses.textLa: Cumque interrogaverit te filius tuus cras, dicens: Quid sibi volunt testimonia hæc, et ceremoniæ, atque iudicia, quæ præcepit Dominus Deus noster nobis?

verses.textEn: You shall say to him: ‘We were servants of Pharaoh in Egypt, and the Lord led us away from Egypt with a strong hand.
verses.textLa: Dices ei: Servi eramus Pharaonis in Ægypto, et eduxit nos Dominus de Ægypto in manu forti:

verses.textEn: And he wrought signs and wonders, great and very grievous, in Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his house, in our sight.
verses.textLa: fecitque signa atque prodigia magna et pessima in Ægypto contra Pharaonem, et omnem domum illius in conspectu nostro,

verses.textEn: And he led us away from that place, so that he might lead us in and give us the land, about which he swore to our fathers.
verses.textLa: et eduxit nos inde, ut introductis daret Terram, super qua iuravit patribus nostris.

verses.textEn: And the Lord instructed us that we should do all these ordinances, and that we should fear the Lord our God, so that it may be well with us all the days of our life, just as it is today.
verses.textLa: Præcepitque nobis Dominus ut faciamus omnia legitima hæc, et timeamus Dominum Deum nostrum, ut bene sit nobis cunctis diebus vitæ nostræ, sicut est hodie.

verses.textEn: And he will be merciful to us, if we keep and perform all his precepts, in the sight of the Lord our God, just as he has commanded us.’ ”
verses.textLa: Eritque nostri misericors, si custodierimus et fecerimus omnia præcepta eius coram Domino Deo nostro, sicut mandavit nobis.

verses.textEn: “When the Lord your God will have led you to the land, which you will enter so as to possess it, and when he will have destroyed many nations before you, the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, seven nations much more numerous than you, and more robust than you,
verses.textLa: Cum introduxerit te Dominus Deus tuus in Terram, quam possessurus ingredieris, et deleverit gentes multas coram te, Hethæum, et Gergezæum, et Amorrhæum, Chananæum, et Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Iebusæum, septem gentes multo maioris numeri quam tu es, et robustiores te:

verses.textEn: and when the Lord your God will have delivered them to you, you shall strike them down unto utter annihilation. You shall not enter into a pact with them, nor shall you show any pity to them.
verses.textLa: tradideritque eas Dominus Deus tuus tibi, percuties eas usque ad internecionem. Non inibis cum eis fœdus, nec misereberis earum,

verses.textEn: And you shall not associate with them in marriage. You shall not give your daughter to his son, nor accept his daughter for your son.
verses.textLa: neque sociabis cum eis coniugia. Filiam tuam non dabis filio eius, nec filiam illius accipies filio tuo:

verses.textEn: For she will seduce your son, so that he will not follow me, and so that he will instead serve foreign gods. And the fury of the Lord will be enraged, and he will quickly destroy you.
verses.textLa: quia seducet filium tuum, ne sequatur me, et ut magis serviat diis alienis. Irasceturque furor Domini, et delebit te cito.

verses.textEn: So instead, you shall do this to them: overturn their altars, and break their statues, and cut down their sacred groves, and burn up their graven images.
verses.textLa: Quin potius hæc facietis eis: Aras eorum subvertite, et confringite statuas, lucosque succidite, et sculptilia comburite.

verses.textEn: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God. The Lord your God has chosen you so that you would be his particular people out of all the peoples who are upon the earth.
verses.textLa: Quia populus sanctus es Domino Deo tuo. Te elegit Dominus Deus tuus, ut sis ei populus peculiaris de cunctis populis, qui sunt super terram.

verses.textEn: It is not because you surpass all the nations in number that the Lord has joined with you and has chosen you, for you are the least numerous of any people.
verses.textLa: Non quia cunctas gentes numero vincebatis, vobis iunctus est Dominus, et elegit vos, cum omnibus sitis populis pauciores:

verses.textEn: But it is because the Lord has loved you, and has kept his oath, which he swore to your fathers. And he has led you away with a strong hand, and he has redeemed you from the house of servitude, from the hand of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt.
verses.textLa: sed quia dilexit vos Dominus, et custodivit iuramentum, quod iuravit patribus vestris: eduxitque vos in manu forti, et redemit de domo servitutis, de manu Pharaonis regis Ægypti.

verses.textEn: And you shall know that the Lord your God himself is a strong and faithful God, preserving his covenant and his mercy for those who love him and those who keep his precepts for a thousand generations,
verses.textLa: Et scies quia Dominus Deus tuus, ipse est Deus fortis et fidelis, custodiens pactum et misericordiam diligentibus se, et his qui custodiunt præcepta eius in mille generationes:

verses.textEn: and promptly repaying those who hate him, so as to utterly ruin them, without further delay, quickly rendering to them what they deserve.
verses.textLa: et reddens odientibus se statim, ita ut disperdat eos, et ultra non differat, protinus eis restituens quod merentur.

verses.textEn: Therefore, keep the precepts and ceremonies as well as the judgments, which I command to you this day, so that you may do them.
verses.textLa: Custodi ergo præcepta et ceremonias atque iudicia, quæ ego mando tibi hodie ut facias.

verses.textEn: If, after you have heard these judgments, you keep and do them, the Lord your God will also keep his covenant with you and the mercy that he swore to your fathers.
verses.textLa: Si postquam audieris hæc iudicia, custodieris ea et feceris, custodiet et Dominus Deus tuus pactum tibi, et misericordiam quam iuravit patribus tuis:

verses.textEn: And he will love you and multiply you. And he will bless the fruit of your womb, and the fruit of your land: your grain as well as your vintage, oil, and herds, and the flocks of your sheep, upon the land about which he swore to your fathers that he would give it to you.
verses.textLa: et diliget te ac multiplicabit, benedicetque fructui ventris tui, et fructui terræ tuæ, frumento tuo, atque vindemiæ, oleo, et armentis, gregibus ovium tuarum super Terram, pro qua iuravit patribus tuis ut daret eam tibi.
verses.notes: Even though ‘ventris’ is translated as ‘womb,’ it refers more generally to the generative (reproductive) capability of both men and women.

verses.textEn: Blessed shall you be among all peoples. No one will be barren among you of either gender, as much among men as among your herds.
verses.textLa: Benedictus eris inter omnes populos. Non erit apud te sterilis utriusque sexus, tam in hominibus quam in gregibus tuis.
verses.notes: Here is a clear example of ‘hominibus’ being used to refer to both genders.

verses.textEn: The Lord will take all sickness away from you. And the very grievous infirmities of Egypt, which you have known, he will not bring upon you, but upon your enemies.
verses.textLa: Auferet Dominus a te omnem languorem: et infirmitates Ægypti pessimas, quas novisti, non inferet tibi, sed cunctis hostibus tuis.

verses.textEn: You shall devour all the peoples, which the Lord your God will deliver to you. Your eye shall not spare them, neither shall you serve their gods, lest they be your ruin.
verses.textLa: Devorabis omnes populos, quos Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi. Non parcet eis oculus tuus, nec servies diis eorum, ne sint in ruinam tui.

verses.textEn: If you say in your heart, ‘These nations are more than I am, so how will I be able to destroy them?’
verses.textLa: Si dixeris in corde tuo: Plures sunt gentes istæ quam ego, quo modo potero delere eas?

verses.textEn: do not be apprehensive. Instead, recall what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all the Egyptians:
verses.textLa: noli metuere, sed recordare quæ fecerit Dominus Deus tuus Pharaoni, et cunctis Ægyptiis,

verses.textEn: the very great plagues, which your eyes saw, and the signs and wonders, and the powerful hand and outstretched arm, by which the Lord your God led you away. So will he do to all the peoples, whom you dread.
verses.textLa: plagas maximas, quas viderunt oculi tui, et signa atque portenta, manumque robustam, et extentum brachium, ut educeret te Dominus Deus tuus. Sic faciet cunctis populis, quos metuis.

verses.textEn: Moreover, the Lord your God will also send hornets among them, until he destroys and scatters all who have escaped from you, or who have been able to hide.
verses.textLa: Insuper et crabrones mittet Dominus Deus tuus in eos, donec deleat omnes atque disperdat qui te fugerint, et latere potuerint.

verses.textEn: You shall not fear them, for the Lord your God is in your midst: a great and terrible God.
verses.textLa: Non timebis eos, quia Dominus Deus tuus in medio tui est, Deus magnus et terribilis:

verses.textEn: He himself will consume these nations in your sight, a little at a time, by degrees. You will not be able to destroy them all at once. Otherwise, the wild beasts of the earth might increase against you.
verses.textLa: ipse consumet nationes has in conspectu tuo paulatim atque per partes. Non poteris eas delere pariter: ne forte multiplicentur contra te bestiæ terræ.

verses.textEn: And so, the Lord your God will present them in your sight, and you shall slay them until they are thoroughly wiped away.
verses.textLa: Dabitque eos Dominus Deus tuus in conspectu tuo: et interficiet illos donec penitus deleantur.

verses.textEn: And he shall deliver their kings into your hands, and you shall abolish their names from under heaven. No one will be able to withstand you, until you crush them.
verses.textLa: Tradetque reges eorum in manus tuas, et disperdes nomina eorum sub cælo: nullus poterit resistere tibi, donec conteras eos.

verses.textEn: Their graven images, you shall burn with fire. You shall not covet the silver or gold from which they have been made. And you shall not take for yourself anything from these, lest you offend, because this is an abomination to the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Sculptilia eorum igne combures: non concupisces argentum et aurum, de quibus facta sunt, neque assumes ex eis tibi quidquam, ne offendas, propterea quia abominatio est Domini tui.

verses.textEn: Neither shall you carry anything of the idol into your house, lest you become accursed, just as it also is. You shall detest it like dung, and you shall abominate it like defilement and filth, because it is an accursed thing.”
verses.textLa: Nec inferes quippiam ex idolo in domum tuam, ne fias anathema, sicut et illud est. Quasi spurcitiam detestaberis, et velut inquinamentum ac sordes abominationi habebis, quia anathema est.

verses.textEn: “All the commandments which I am entrusting to you this day, take care to observe them diligently, so that you may live and be multiplied, and so that, upon entering, you may possess the land, about which the Lord swore to your fathers.
verses.textLa: Omne mandatum, quod ego præcipio tibi hodie, cave diligenter ut facias: ut possitis vivere, et multiplicemini, ingressique possideatis Terram, pro qua iuravit Dominus patribus vestris.

verses.textEn: And you shall remember the entire journey along which the Lord your God led you, for forty years through the desert, to afflict you, and to test you, and to make known the things that were turning in your soul, whether or not you would keep his commandments.
verses.textLa: Et recordaberis cuncti itineris, per quod adduxit te Dominus Deus tuus quadraginta annis per desertum, ut affligeret te, atque tentaret, et nota fierent quæ in tuo animo versabantur, utrum custodires mandata illius, an non.

verses.textEn: He afflicted you with need, and he gave you Manna as your food, which neither you nor your fathers knew, so as to reveal to you that it is not by bread alone that man lives, but by every word that goes forth from the mouth of God.
verses.textLa: Afflixit te penuria, et dedit tibi cibum Manna, quod ignorabas tu et patres tui: ut ostenderet tibi quod non in solo pane vivat homo, sed in omni verbo quod egreditur de ore Dei.

verses.textEn: Your garment, with which you were covered, has by no means decayed due to age, and your foot has not been worn down, even to this fortieth year,
verses.textLa: Vestimentum tuum, quo operiebaris, nequaquam vetustate defecit, et pes tuus non est subtritus, en quadragesimus annus est.

verses.textEn: so that you would recognize in your heart that, just as a man educates his son, so has the Lord your God educated you.
verses.textLa: Ut recogites in corde tuo, quia sicut erudit filium suum homo, sic Dominus Deus tuus erudivit te,

verses.textEn: So may you keep the commandments of the Lord your God, and walk in his ways, and fear him.
verses.textLa: ut custodias mandata Domini Dei tui, et ambules in viis eius, et timeas eum.

verses.textEn: For the Lord your God will lead you into a good land: a land of brooks and waters and fountains, in which deep rivers burst forth from its plains and mountains,
verses.textLa: Dominus enim Deus tuus introducet te in terram bonam, terram rivorum aquarumque et fontium: in cuius campis et montibus erumpunt fluviorum abyssi:

verses.textEn: a land of crops, barley, and vineyards, in which fig and pomegranate and olive trees spring up, a land of oil and honey.
verses.textLa: terram frumenti, hordei, ac vinearum, in qua ficus, et malogranata, et oliveta nascuntur: terram olei ac mellis.

verses.textEn: In that place, without any need, you shall eat your bread and enjoy an abundance of all things: where the stones are like iron, and where ore for brass is dug out of its mountains.
verses.textLa: Ubi absque ulla penuria comedes panem tuum, et rerum omnium abundantia perfrueris: cuius lapides ferrum sunt, et de montibus eius æris metalla fodiuntur:

verses.textEn: So then, when you have eaten and been satisfied, you should bless the Lord your God for the excellent land which he has given to you.
verses.textLa: ut cum comederis, et satiatus fueris, benedicas Domino Deo tuo pro terra optima, quam dedit tibi.

verses.textEn: Be observant and cautious, lest at some time you may forget the Lord your God, and neglect his commandments, as well as the judgments and ceremonies, which I instruct to you this day.
