verses.textEn: he shall minister in the name of the Lord his God, as do all his brothers, the Levites, who will be standing at that time in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: ministrabit in nomine Domini Dei sui, sicut omnes fratres eius Levitæ, qui stabunt eo tempore coram Domino.

verses.textEn: He shall receive the same portion of food as the rest also receive, besides that which is due to him in his own city, by succession from his fathers.
verses.textLa: Partem ciborum eamdem accipiet, quam et ceteri: excepto eo, quod in urbe sua ex paterna ei successione debetur.

verses.textEn: When you will have entered into the land which the Lord your God will give to you, be careful that you are not willing to imitate the abominations of those nations.
verses.textLa: Quando ingressus fueris Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, cave ne imitari velis abominationes illarum gentium.

verses.textEn: Do not let there be found among you one who would purify his son or daughter by leading them through fire, nor one who consults seers, nor one who observes dreams or omens. Do not let there be found among you one who practices the occult,
verses.textLa: Nec inveniatur in te qui lustret filium suum, aut filiam, ducens per ignem: aut qui ariolos sciscitetur, et observet somnia atque auguria, nec sit maleficus,

verses.textEn: nor one who uses spells, nor one who consults demonic spirits, nor a diviner, nor one who seeks the truth from the dead.
verses.textLa: nec incantantor, nec qui pythones consulat, nec divinos, aut quærat a mortuis veritatem.

verses.textEn: For the Lord abominates all these things. And, because of these wicked ways, he will destroy them at your arrival.
verses.textLa: Omnia enim hæc abominatur Dominus, et propter istiusmodi scelera delebit eos in introitu tuo.

verses.textEn: You shall be perfect and without blemish with the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Perfectus eris, et absque macula cum Domino Deo tuo.

verses.textEn: These nations, whose land you shall possess, they listen to soothsayers and diviners. But you have been otherwise instructed by the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Gentes istæ, quarum possidebis terram, augures et divinos audiunt: tu autem a Domino Deo tuo aliter institutus es.

verses.textEn: The Lord your God will raise up for you a PROPHET from your nation and from your brothers, similar to me. You shall listen to him,
verses.textLa: PROPHETAM de gente tua et de fratribus tuis sicut me, suscitabit tibi Dominus Deus tuus: ipsum audies,

verses.textEn: just as you petitioned of the Lord your God at Horeb, when the assembly was gathered together, and you said: ‘Let me no longer hear the voice of the Lord my God, and let me no longer see this very great fire, lest I die.’
verses.textLa: ut petisti a Domino Deo tuo in Horeb, quando concio congregata est, atque dixisti: Ultra non audiam vocem Domini Dei mei, et ignem hunc maximum amplius non videbo, ne moriar.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to me: ‘They have spoken all these things well.
verses.textLa: Et ait Dominus mihi: Bene omnia sunt locuti.

verses.textEn: I will raise up a prophet for them, from the midst of their brothers, similar to you. And I will place my words in his mouth, and he will speak to them all the things that I will instruct him.
verses.textLa: Prophetam suscitabo eis de medio fratrum suorum similem tui: et ponam verba mea in ore eius, loqueturque ad eos omnia quæ præcepero illi.

verses.textEn: But against anyone who is not willing to listen to his words, which he will speak in my name, I will stand forth as the avenger.
verses.textLa: Qui autem verba eius, quæ loquetur in nomine meo, audire noluerit, ego ultor existam.

verses.textEn: But if a prophet, having been corrupted by arrogance, chooses to speak, in my name, things which I did not instruct him to say, or to speak in the name of foreign gods, he shall be put to death.
verses.textLa: Propheta autem qui arrogantia depravatus voluerit loqui in nomine meo, quæ ego non præcepi illi ut diceret, aut ex nomine alienorum deorum, interficietur.

verses.textEn: But if, in silent thought, you respond: “How will I be able to recognize a word which the Lord has not spoken?”
verses.textLa: Quod si tacita cogitatione responderis: Quo modo possum intelligere verbum, quod Dominus non est locutus?

verses.textEn: you shall have this sign. If whatever that prophet predicts in the name of the Lord does not happen, then the Lord has not spoken it. Instead, the prophet has formed it through the swelling of his own mind. And for this reason, you shall not fear him.’ ”
verses.textLa: Hoc habebis signum: Quod in nomine Domini propheta ille prædixerit, et non evenerit: hoc Dominus non est locutus, sed per tumorem animi sui propheta confinxit: et idcirco non timebis eum.

verses.textEn: “When the Lord your God will have destroyed the nations, whose land he will deliver to you, and when you possess it and live in its cities and buildings,
verses.textLa: Cum disperdiderit Dominus Deus tuus gentes, quarum tibi traditurus est terram, et possederis eam, habitaverisque in urbibus eius et in ædibus:

verses.textEn: you shall separate for yourselves three cities in the midst of the land, which the Lord will give to you as a possession,
verses.textLa: tres civitates separabis tibi in medio Terræ, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi in possessionem,

verses.textEn: paving the road carefully. And you shall divide the entire province of your land equally into three parts, so that he who is forced to flee because of manslaughter may have a place nearby to which he may be able to escape.
verses.textLa: sternens diligenter viam: et in tres æqualiter partes totam Terræ tuæ provinciam divides: ut habeat e vicino qui propter homicidium profugus est, quo possit evadere.

verses.textEn: This shall be the law of the killer who flees, whose life is to be saved. Whoever strikes down his neighbor unwillingly, and who has been proven to have had no hatred against him yesterday and the day before,
verses.textLa: Hæc erit lex homicidæ fugientis, cuius vita servanda est: Qui percusserit proximum suum nesciens, et qui heri et nudiustertius nullum contra eum odium habuisse comprobatur:

verses.textEn: such that he had gone with him into the forest simply to cut wood, and in cutting down the tree, the axe slipped from his hand, or the iron slipped from the handle, and it struck his friend and killed him: he shall flee to one of the cities stated above, and he shall live.
verses.textLa: sed abiisse cum eo simpliciter in silvam ad ligna cædenda, et in succisione lignorum securis fugerit manu, ferrumque lapsum de manubrio amicum eius percusserit, et occiderit: hic ad unam supradictarum urbium confugiet, et vivet:

verses.textEn: Otherwise, perhaps the near relative of him whose blood was shed, impelled by his grief, might pursue and apprehend him, unless the way is too long, and he might strike down the life of him who is not guilty unto death, since he had demonstrated that he had no prior hatred against him who was slain.
verses.textLa: ne forsitan proximus eius, cuius effusus est sanguis, dolore stimulatus, persequatur, et apprehendat eum si longior via fuerit, et percutiat animam eius, qui non est reus mortis: quia nullum contra eum, qui occisus est, odium prius habuisse monstratur.

verses.textEn: For this reason, I instruct you to separate three cities at equal distance from one another.
verses.textLa: Idcirco præcipio tibi, ut tres civitates æqualis inter se spatii dividas.

verses.textEn: And when the Lord your God will have enlarged your borders, just as he swore to your fathers, and when he will have given to you all the land that he has promised to them,
verses.textLa: Cum autem dilataverit Dominus Deus tuus terminos tuos, sicut iuravit patribus tuis, et dederit tibi cunctam Terram, quam eis pollicitus est

verses.textEn: (but this is only so if you will keep his commandments and do the things which I instruct to you this day, so that you love the Lord your God, and walk in his ways at all times) you shall add for yourselves three other cities, and so you shall double the number of the three cities stated above.
verses.textLa: (si tamen custodieris mandata eius, et feceris quæ hodie præcipio tibi, ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum, et ambules in viis eius omni tempore) addes tibi tres alias civitates, et supradictarum trium urbium numerum duplicabis:

verses.textEn: So may innocent blood not be shed in the midst of the land which the Lord your God will give you to possess, lest you be guilty of blood.
verses.textLa: ut non effundatur sanguis innoxius in medio Terræ, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi possidendam, ne sis sanguinis reus.

verses.textEn: But if anyone, having hatred for his neighbor, will have lain in ambush for his life, and, rising up, will have struck him, and he will have died, and if he will have fled to one of the cities stated above,
verses.textLa: Si quis autem odio habens proximum suum, insidiatus fuerit vitæ eius, surgensque percusserit illum, et mortuus fuerit, fugeritque ad unam de supradictis urbibus,

verses.textEn: the elders of his city shall send, and they shall take him from the place of refuge, and they shall deliver him into the hand of the relative of him whose blood was shed, and he shall die.
verses.textLa: mittent seniores civitatis illius, et arripient eum de loco effugii, tradentque in manu proximi, cuius sanguis effusus est, et morietur.

verses.textEn: You shall not take pity on him, and so shall you take away the blood of the innocent from Israel, so that it may be well with you.
verses.textLa: Non miseraberis eius, et auferes innoxium sanguinem de Israel, ut bene sit tibi.

verses.textEn: You shall not take up or move the landmark of your neighbor, which those before you have placed, in your possession that the Lord your God will give to you, in the land you will receive to possess.
verses.textLa: Non assumes, et transferes terminos proximi tui, quos fixerunt priores in possessione tua, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi in Terra, quam acceperis possidendam.

verses.textEn: One witness shall not stand against another, no matter what the sin or outrage may be. For every word shall stand by the mouth of two or three witnesses.
verses.textLa: Non stabit testis unus contra aliquem, quidquid illud peccati, et facinoris fuerit: sed in ore duorum aut trium testium stabit omne verbum.

verses.textEn: If a lying witness will have stood against a man, accusing him of a transgression,
verses.textLa: Si steterit testis mendax contra hominem, accusans eum prævaricationis,

verses.textEn: both of those whose case it is shall stand before the Lord in the sight of the priests and the judges who shall be in those days.
verses.textLa: stabunt ambo, quorum causa est, ante Dominum in conspectu sacerdotum et iudicum qui fuerint in diebus illis.

verses.textEn: And when, after a very diligent examination, they will have found that the false witness had told a lie against his brother,
verses.textLa: Cumque diligentissime perscrutantes, invenerint falsum testem dixisse contra fratrem suum mendacium:

verses.textEn: they shall render to him just as he intended to do to his brother. And so shall you take away the evil from your midst.
verses.textLa: reddent ei sicut fratri suo facere cogitavit, et auferes malum de medio tui:

verses.textEn: Then the others, upon hearing this, will be afraid, and they will by no means dare to do such things.
verses.textLa: ut audientes ceteri timorem habeant, et nequaquam talia audeant facere.

verses.textEn: You shall not take pity on him. Instead, you shall require a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, a hand for a hand, a foot for a foot.”
verses.textLa: Non misereberis eius, sed animam pro anima, oculum pro oculo, dentem pro dente, manum pro manu, pedem pro pede exiges.

verses.textEn: “If you go out to battle against your enemies, and you see horsemen and chariots, and that the multitude of your adversary’s army is greater than your own, you shall not fear them. For the Lord your God, who led you away from the land of Egypt, is with you.
verses.textLa: Si exieris ad bellum contra hostes tuos, et videris equitatus et currus, et maiorem quam tu habeas adversarii exercitus multitudinem, non timebis eos: quia Dominus Deus tuus tecum est, qui eduxit te de Terra Ægypti.

verses.textEn: Then, as the battle now draws near, the priest shall stand before the front ranks, and he shall speak to the people in this manner:
verses.textLa: Appropinquante autem iam prælio, stabit sacerdos ante aciem, et sic loquetur ad populum:

verses.textEn: ‘Listen, O Israel! Today you engage in a battle against your enemies. Do not let your heart be overwhelmed with fear. Do not be apprehensive. Do not yield. You should have no dread of them.
verses.textLa: Audi Israel, vos hodie contra inimicos vestros pugnam committitis, non pertimescat cor vestrum, nolite metuere, nolite cedere, nec formidetis eos:

verses.textEn: For the Lord your God is in your midst, and he will contend against your enemies on your behalf, so that he may rescue you from peril.’
verses.textLa: quia Dominus Deus vester in medio vestri est, et pro vobis contra adversarios dimicabit, ut eruat vos de periculo.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the officers shall proclaim, throughout every company, in the hearing of the soldiers: ‘What man is there who has built a new house, and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest perhaps he may die in the battle, and another man may dedicate it.
verses.textLa: Duces quoque per singulas turmas audiente exercitu proclamabunt: Quis est homo, qui ædificavit domum novam, et non dedicavit eam? Vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius dedicet eam.

verses.textEn: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not yet caused it to be common, so that all may eat from it? Let him go, and return to his house, lest perhaps he may die in the battle, and another man may carry out his office.
verses.textLa: Quis est homo qui plantavit vineam, et necdum fecit eam esse communem, de qua vesci omnibus liceat? Vadat, et revertatur in domum suam: ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius homo eius fungatur officio.

verses.textEn: What man is there, who has betrothed a wife, and has not taken her? Let him go, and return to his house, lest perhaps he may die in battle, and another man may take her.’
verses.textLa: Quis est homo, qui despondit uxorem, et non accepit eam? Vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius homo accipiat eam.

verses.textEn: After these things have been declared, they shall add the remainder, and shall say to the people: ‘What man is there who is overwhelmed by fear and is fainthearted? Let him go, and return to his house, lest he cause the hearts of his brothers to fear, just as he himself has been thoroughly stricken with fear.’
verses.textLa: His dictis addent reliqua, et loquentur ad populum: Quis est homo formidolosus, et corde pavido? Vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne pavere faciat corda fratrum suorum, sicut ipse timore perterritus est.

verses.textEn: And when the officers of the army have become silent, and have completed their speech, each one shall prepare his unit to wage war.
verses.textLa: Cumque siluerint duces exercitus, et finem loquendi fecerint, unusquisque suos ad bellandum cuneos præparabit.

verses.textEn: When, at any time, you approach a city to fight against it, you shall first offer peace to it.
verses.textLa: Si quando accesseris ad expugnandam civitatem, offeres ei primum pacem.

verses.textEn: If they receive it, and open the gates to you, then all the people who are in it shall be saved, and they shall serve you by paying tribute.
verses.textLa: Si receperit, et aperuerit tibi portas, cunctus populus, qui in ea est, salvabitur, et serviet tibi sub tributo.

verses.textEn: But if they are not willing to enter into an agreement, and they begin to act against you in warfare, then you shall besiege it.
verses.textLa: Sin autem fœdus inire noluerit, et cœperit contra te bellum, oppugnabis eam.

verses.textEn: And when the Lord your God will have delivered it into your hands, you shall strike down anyone who is in it, of the male gender, with the edge of the sword,
verses.textLa: Cumque tradiderit Dominus Deus tuus illam in manu tua, percuties omne, quod in ea generis masculini est, in ore gladii,

verses.textEn: but not the women and young children, nor the cattle and the other things that are within the city. And you shall divide all the plunder to the soldiers, and you shall eat the spoils from your enemies, which the Lord your God will give to you.
verses.textLa: absque mulieribus et infantibus, iumentis et ceteris, quæ in civitate sunt. Omnem prædam exercitui divides, et comedes de spoliis hostium tuorum, quæ Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi.

verses.textEn: So shall you do to all the cities which are at a great distance from you, those which are not among the cities that you shall receive as a possession.
verses.textLa: Sic facies cunctis civitatibus, quæ a te procul valde sunt, et non sunt de his urbibus, quas in possessionem accepturus es.

verses.textEn: But among those cities which shall be given to you, you shall not permit anyone at all to live.
verses.textLa: De his autem civitatibus, quæ dabuntur tibi, nullum omnino permittes vivere:

verses.textEn: Instead, you shall put them to death with the edge of the sword, specifically: the Hittite and the Amorite and the Canaanite, the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, just as the Lord your God has commanded you.
verses.textLa: sed interficies in ore gladii, Hethæum videlicet, et Amorrhæum, et Chananæum, Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Iebusæum, sicut præcepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus:

verses.textEn: Otherwise, they may teach you to do all the abominations which they have committed for their own gods. And then you would sin against the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: ne forte doceant vos facere cunctas abominationes, quas ipsi operati sunt diis suis: et peccetis in Dominum Deum vestrum.

verses.textEn: When you will have besieged a city for a long time, and you will have encircled it with fortifications, so that you may fight against it, you shall not cut down trees from which one is able to eat, neither shall you cause devastation with axes to the surrounding region. For it is a tree, and not a man. It is not able to increase the number of those who are fighting against you.
verses.textLa: Quando obsederis civitatem multo tempore, et munitionibus circumdederis ut expugnes eam, non succides arbores, de quibus vesci potest, nec securibus per circuitum debes vastare regionem: quoniam lignum est, et non homo, nec potest bellantium contra te augere numerum.

verses.textEn: But if there are any trees which are not fruitful, but are wild, and if these are fit for other uses, then cut them down, and make machines, until you have captured the city that is contending against you.”
verses.textLa: Si qua autem ligna non sunt pomifera, sed agrestia, et in ceteros apta usus, succide, et instrue machinas, donec capias civitatem, quæ contra te dimicat.

verses.textEn: “When there will have been found in the land, which the Lord your God will give to you, the corpse of a man who has been killed, and it is not known who is guilty of the murder,
verses.textLa: Quando inventum fuerit in terra, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi, hominis cadaver occisi, et ignorabitur cædis reus,

verses.textEn: your judges and those greater by birth shall go out and measure, from the place of the corpse, the distance to each of the surrounding cities.
verses.textLa: egredientur maiores natu, et iudices tui, et metientur a loco cadaveris singularum per circuitum spatia civitatum:

verses.textEn: And in whichever one they perceive to be closer than the others, the elders shall take a calf from the herd, one which has not pulled with a yoke, nor tilled with a plow.
verses.textLa: et quam viciniorem ceteris esse perspexerint, seniores civitatis illius tollent vitulam de armento, quæ non traxit iugum, nec terram scidit vomere,

verses.textEn: And they shall lead it into a rough and stony valley, one which has never been tilled or sown. And in that place, they shall cut the neck of the calf.
verses.textLa: et ducent eam ad vallem asperam atque saxosam, quæ numquam arata est, nec sementem recepit: et cædent in ea cervices vitulæ:
verses.notes: The calf which has never worn a yoke or tilled the ground, and the untilled valley, both represent innocence. The cutting of the calf’s neck, spilling its blood onto the ground, represents the shedding of the blood of the innocent.

verses.textEn: And the priests the sons of Levi shall approach, those whom the Lord your God has chosen to minister to him, and to bless in his name, and to decide every controversy by their word, and to judge which things are clean and which are unclean.
verses.textLa: accedentque sacerdotes filii Levi, quos elegerit Dominus Deus tuus ut ministrent ei, et benedicant in nomine eius, et ad verbum eorum omne negotium, et quidquid mundum, vel immundum est, iudicetur.

verses.textEn: And those greater by birth of that city, nearest to the one who was slain, shall go and shall wash their hands over the calf that was killed in the valley.
verses.textLa: Et venient maiores natu civitatis illius ad interfectum, lavabuntque manus suas super vitulam, quæ in valle percussa est,

verses.textEn: And they shall say: ‘Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it.
verses.textLa: et dicent: Manus nostræ non effuderunt sanguinem hunc, nec oculi viderunt.

verses.textEn: Be merciful to your people Israel, whom you have redeemed, O Lord, and do not charge them with innocent blood in the midst of your people Israel.’ And so the guilt of the blood will be taken away from them.
verses.textLa: Propitius esto populo tuo Israel, quem redemisti Domine, et ne reputes sanguinem innocentem in medio populi tui Israel. Et auferetur ab eis reatus sanguinis:

verses.textEn: Then you will be free from the blood that was shed against the innocent, when you will have done as the Lord has instructed you.
verses.textLa: tu autem alienus eris ab innocentis cruore, qui fusus est, cum feceris quod præcepit Dominus.

verses.textEn: If you have gone out to fight against your enemies, and the Lord your God has delivered them into your hand, and if, as you are leading away the captives,
verses.textLa: Si egressus fueris ad pugnam contra inimicos tuos, et tradiderit eos Dominus Deus tuus in manu tua, captivosque duxeris,

verses.textEn: you see among the number of the captives a beautiful woman, and you love her, and you are willing to have her as a wife:
verses.textLa: et videris in numero captivorum mulierem pulchram, et adamaveris eam, voluerisque habere uxorem,

verses.textEn: then you shall lead her into your house. And she shall shave off her hair, and cut her nails short,
verses.textLa: introduces eam in domum tuam: quæ radet cæsariem, et circumcidet ungues,

verses.textEn: and remove the garment in which she was captured. And she shall sit in your house and weep for her father and mother, for one month. And after that, you shall enter to her and sleep with her, and she shall be your wife.
verses.textLa: et deponet vestem, in qua capta est: sedensque in domo tua, flebit patrem et matrem suam uno mense: et postea intrabis ad eam, dormiesque cum illa, et erit uxor tua.

verses.textEn: But if afterwards she does not sit well in your mind, you shall set her free. You cannot sell her for money, nor can you oppress her by force. For you have humiliated her.
verses.textLa: Si autem postea non sederit animo tuo, dimittes eam liberam, nec vendere poteris pecunia, nec opprimere per potentiam: quia humiliasti eam.

verses.textEn: If a man has two wives, one beloved and the other hated, and they have produced children by him, and if the son of the hated wife is the firstborn,
verses.textLa: Si habuerit homo uxores duas, unam dilectam, et alteram odiosam, genuerintque ex eo liberos, et fuerit filius odiosæ primogenitus,

verses.textEn: and if he wishes to divide his substance among his sons: he cannot make the son of the beloved wife the firstborn, and so prefer him before the son of the hated wife.
verses.textLa: volueritque substantiam inter filios suos dividere: non poterit filium dilectæ facere primogenitum, et præferre filio odiosæ,

verses.textEn: Instead, he shall acknowledge the son of the hated wife as the firstborn, and he shall give to him a double portion of all that he has. For he is the first among his children, and the rights of the firstborn are owed to him.
verses.textLa: sed filium odiosæ agnoscet primogenitum, dabitque ei de his quæ habuerit cuncta duplicia: iste est enim principium liberorum eius, et huic debentur primogenita.

verses.textEn: If a man produces a disobedient and reckless son, who will not listen to the orders of his father or mother, and, having been corrected, shows contempt for obedience:
verses.textLa: Si genuerit homo filium contumacem et protervum, qui non audiat patris aut matris imperium, et coercitus obedire contempserit:

verses.textEn: they shall take him and lead him to the elders of the city and to the gate of judgment.
verses.textLa: apprehendent eum, et ducent ad seniores civitatis illius, et ad portam iudicii,

verses.textEn: And they shall say to them: ‘This our son is reckless and disobedient. He shows contempt when listening to our admonitions. He occupies himself with carousing, and self-indulgence, and feasting.’
verses.textLa: dicentque ad eos: Filius noster iste protervus et contumax est, monita nostra audire contemnit, comessationibus vacat, et luxuriæ atque conviviis:

verses.textEn: Then the people of the city shall stone him to death. And he shall die, so that you may take away the evil from your midst. And so may all of Israel, upon hearing it, be very afraid.
verses.textLa: lapidibus eum obruet populus civitatis: et morietur, ut auferatis malum de medio vestri, et universus Israel audiens pertimescat.

verses.textEn: When a man will have sinned in a matter which is punished by death, and, having been judged unto death, he has been hanged on a gallows:
verses.textLa: Quando peccaverit homo quod morte plectendum est, et adiudicatus morti appensus fuerit in patibulo:

verses.textEn: his corpse shall not remain on the tree. Instead, he shall be buried on the same day. For he who hangs from a tree has been cursed by God, and you shall not defile your land, which the Lord your God will give to you as a possession.”
verses.textLa: non permanebit cadaver eius in ligno, sed in eadem die sepelietur: quia maledictus a Deo est qui pendet in ligno: et nequaquam contaminabis Terram tuam, quam Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi in possessionem.

verses.textEn: “If you see your brother’s ox or sheep wander astray, you shall not pass by. Instead, you shall lead them back to your brother.
verses.textLa: Non videbis bovem fratris tui, aut ovem errantem, et præteribis: sed reduces fratri tuo,

verses.textEn: But if your brother is not near, or you do not know him, you shall lead them to your house, and they shall be with you until your brother seeks them and receives them.
verses.textLa: etiam si non est propinquus frater tuus, nec nosti eum: duces in domum tuam, et erunt apud te quamdiu quærat ea frater tuus, et recipiat.

verses.textEn: You shall act in a similar manner with his donkey, and his clothing, and all the belongings of your brother that have been lost. If you find it, you shall not neglect it, as if it belonged to a stranger.
verses.textLa: Similiter facies de asino, et de vestimento, et de omni re fratris tui, quæ perierit: si inveneris eam, ne negligas quasi alienam.

verses.textEn: If you see that your brother’s donkey or ox has fallen along the way, you shall not disregard it. Instead, you shall lift it up with him.
verses.textLa: Si videris asinum fratris tui aut bovem cecidisse in via, non despicies, sed sublevabis cum eo.

verses.textEn: A woman shall not be clothed with manly apparel, nor shall a man make use of feminine apparel. For whoever does these things is abominable with God.
verses.textLa: Non induetur mulier veste virili, nec vir utetur veste feminea: abominabilis enim apud Deum est qui facit hæc.

verses.textEn: If, as you are walking along the way, you find a bird’s nest, in a tree or on the ground, and the mother is nurturing the young or the eggs, you shall not take her with her young.
verses.textLa: Si ambulans per viam, in arbore vel in terra nidum avis inveneris, et matrem pullis vel ovis desuper incubantem: non tenebis eam cum filiis,

verses.textEn: Instead, you shall permit her to go, retaining the young that you have caught, so that it may be well with you, and you may live for a long time.
verses.textLa: sed abire patieris, captos tenens filios: ut bene sit tibi, et longo vivas tempore.

verses.textEn: When you build a new house, you shall make a wall around the roof. Otherwise, someone may slip and fall down violently, and so blood would be shed at your house, and you would be guilty.
verses.textLa: Cum ædificaveris domum novam, facies murum tecti per circuitum: ne effundatur sanguis in domo tua, et sis reus labente alio, et in præceps ruente.

verses.textEn: You shall not sow your vineyard with another seed, lest both the seed that you have sown and what springs forth from the vineyard be sanctified together.
verses.textLa: Non seres vineam tuam altero semine: ne et sementis quam sevisti, et quæ nascuntur ex vinea, pariter sanctificentur.

verses.textEn: You shall not till with an ox and a donkey at the same time.
verses.textLa: Non arabis in bove simul et asino.

verses.textEn: You shall not wear a vestment which has been woven from both wool and linen.
verses.textLa: Non indueris vestimento, quod ex lana linoque contextum est.

verses.textEn: You shall make strings along the hem, at the four corners of your cloak, which covers you.
verses.textLa: Funiculos in fimbriis facies per quattuor angulos pallii tui, quo operieris.

verses.textEn: If a man takes a wife, and afterwards he has hatred for her,
verses.textLa: Si duxerit vir uxorem, et postea odio habuerit eam,

verses.textEn: and so he seeks opportunities to dismiss her, imputing a very wicked name to her by saying, ‘I received this woman as a wife, and upon entering to her, I found her not to be a virgin,’
verses.textLa: quæsieritque occasiones quibus dimittat eam, obiiciens ei nomen pessimum, et dixerit: Uxorem hanc accepi, et ingressus ad eam non inveni virginem:

verses.textEn: then her father and mother shall take her, and they shall bring with them the signs of her virginity, to the elders of the city who are at the gate.
verses.textLa: tollent eam pater et mater eius, et ferent secum signa virginitatis eius ad seniores urbis qui in porta sunt:

verses.textEn: And the father shall say: ‘I gave my daughter to this man as a wife. And because he hates her,
verses.textLa: et dicet pater: Filiam meam dedi huic uxorem: quam quia odit,

verses.textEn: he accuses her with a very wicked name, by saying: “I did not find your daughter to be a virgin.” But behold, these are the signs of my daughter’s virginity.’ And they shall spread the clothing before the elders of the city.
verses.textLa: imponit ei nomen pessimum, ut dicat: Non inveni filiam tuam virginem: et ecce hæc sunt signa virginitatis filiæ meæ. Expandent vestimentum coram senioribus civitatis:

verses.textEn: And the elders of that city shall apprehend that man and beat him.
verses.textLa: apprehendentque senes urbis illius virum, et verberabunt illum,

verses.textEn: Moreover, they shall fine him one hundred shekels of silver, which he will give to the father of the girl, because he has committed slander, with a very wicked name, against a virgin of Israel. And he shall have her as a wife, and he cannot dismiss her throughout all the days of his life.
verses.textLa: condemnantes insuper centum siclis argenti, quos dabit patri puellæ, quoniam diffamavit nomen pessimum super virginem Israel: habebitque eam uxorem, et non poterit dimittere eam omnibus diebus vitæ suæ.

verses.textEn: But if what he has claimed is true and virginity is not found in the girl,
verses.textLa: Quod si verum est quod obiicit, et non est in puella inventa virginitas:

verses.textEn: then they shall throw her down, outside the doors of her father’s house, and the men of that city shall stone her to death, and she shall die. For she has acted wickedly in Israel, in that she fornicated in her father’s house. And so shall you take away the evil from your midst.
verses.textLa: eiicient eam extra fores domus patris sui, et lapidibus obruent viri civitatis illius, et morietur: quoniam fecit nefas in Israel, ut fornicaretur in domo patris sui: et auferes malum de medio tui.

verses.textEn: If a man sleeps with the wife of another, then they shall both die, that is, the adulterer and the adulteress. And so shall you take away the evil from Israel.
verses.textLa: Si dormierit vir cum uxore alterius, uterque morietur, id est, adulter et adultera: et auferes malum de Israel.

verses.textEn: If a man has betrothed a girl who is a virgin, and if someone finds her in the city and he lies with her,
verses.textLa: Si puellam virginem desponderit vir, et invenerit eam aliquis in civitate, et concubuerit cum ea,

verses.textEn: then you shall lead them both out to the gate of that city, and they shall be stoned to death: the girl, because she did not cry out though she was in the city; the man, because he has humiliated the wife of his neighbor. And so shall you take away the evil from your midst.
verses.textLa: educes utrumque ad portam civitatis illius, et lapidibus obruentur: puella, quia non clamavit, cum esset in civitate: vir, quia humiliavit uxorem proximi sui. Et auferes malum de medio tui.

verses.textEn: But if a man discovers, in the countryside, a girl who has been betrothed, and, apprehending her, he lies with her, then he alone shall die.
verses.textLa: Sin autem in agro repererit vir puellam, quæ desponsata est, et apprehendens concubuerit cum ea, ipse morietur solus:

verses.textEn: The girl shall suffer nothing, nor is she guilty unto death. For just as a robber rises up against his brother and slays his life, so also did the girl suffer greatly.
verses.textLa: puella nihil patietur, nec est rea mortis: quoniam sicut latro consurgit contra fratrem suum, et occidit animam eius, ita et puella perpessa est.

verses.textEn: She was alone in the field. She cried out, and there was no one nearby, who might deliver her.
verses.textLa: Sola erat in agro: clamavit, et nullus affuit qui liberaret eam.

verses.textEn: If a man finds a girl who is a virgin, who does not have a betrothal, and, taking her, he lies with her, and the matter is brought to judgment,
verses.textLa: Si invenerit vir puellam virginem, quæ non habet sponsum, et apprehendens concubuerit cum illa, et res ad iudicium venerit:

verses.textEn: then he who slept with her shall give to the father of the girl fifty shekels of silver, and he shall have her as a wife, because he has humiliated her. He cannot dismiss her, throughout all the days of his life.
verses.textLa: dabit qui dormivit cum ea, patri puellæ quinquaginta siclos argenti, et habebit eam uxorem, quia humiliavit illam: non poterit dimittere eam cunctis diebus vitæ suæ.

verses.textEn: No man shall take his father’s wife, nor remove her covering.”
verses.textLa: Non accipiet homo uxorem patris sui, nec revelabit operimentum eius.

verses.textEn: “A eunuch, one whose testicles have been debilitated or cut off, or whose penis has been cut off, shall not enter into the church of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non intravit eunuchus attritis vel amputatis testiculis et abscisso veretro, ecclesiam Domini.

verses.textEn: The offspring of a harlot, that is, one born of a prostitute, shall not enter into the church of the Lord, until the tenth generation.
verses.textLa: Non ingredietur mamzer, hoc est, de scorto natus, in ecclesiam Domini, usque ad decimam generationem.

verses.textEn: The Ammonite and the Moabite, even after the tenth generation, shall not enter into the church of the Lord forever,
verses.textLa: Ammonites et Moabites etiam post decimam generationem non intrabunt ecclesiam Domini, in æternum:

verses.textEn: because they were not willing to meet you with bread and water along the way, when you had departed from Egypt, and because they hired against you Balaam, the son of Beor, from Mesopotamia in Syria, in order to curse you.
verses.textLa: quia noluerunt vobis occurrere cum pane et aqua in via quando egressi estis de Ægypto: et quia conduxerunt contra te Balaam filium Beor de Mesopotamia Syriæ, ut malediceret tibi:

verses.textEn: But the Lord your God was not willing to listen to Balaam, and he turned his cursing into your blessing, because he loves you.
verses.textLa: et noluit Dominus Deus tuus audire Balaam, vertitque maledictionem eius in benedictionem tuam, eo quod diligeret te.

verses.textEn: You shall not make peace with them, nor shall you seek their prosperity, throughout all the days of your life forever.
verses.textLa: Non facies cum eis pacem, nec quæras eis bona cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ in sempiternum.

verses.textEn: You shall not abhor anyone from Idumea, for he is your brother, nor the Egyptian, for you were a new arrival in his land.
verses.textLa: Non abominaberis Idumæum, quia frater tuus est: nec Ægyptium, quia advena fuisti in terra eius.

verses.textEn: Those who have been born of them, in the third generation, shall enter into the church of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Qui nati fuerint ex eis, tertia generatione intrabunt in ecclesiam Domini.

verses.textEn: When you have gone out to war against your enemies, you shall keep yourself from everything that is evil.
verses.textLa: Quando egressus fueris adversus hostes tuos in pugnam, custodies te ab omni re mala.

verses.textEn: If there is a man among you who has been defiled by a dream in the night, he shall depart from the camp.
verses.textLa: Si fuerit inter vos homo, qui nocturno pollutus sit somnio, egredietur extra castra,

verses.textEn: And he shall not return before the evening, after he has washed with water, and then, after the sun sets, he shall return to the camp.
verses.textLa: et non revertetur, priusquam ad vesperam lavetur aqua: et post solis occasum regredietur in castra.

verses.textEn: You shall have a place beyond the camp to which you may go for the necessities of nature,
verses.textLa: Habebis locum extra castra, ad quem egrediaris ad requisita naturæ,

verses.textEn: carrying a small shovel at your belt. And when you would sit down, you shall dig around, and then, with the soil that was dug up, you shall cover
verses.textLa: gerens paxillum in balteo. Cumque sederis, fodies per circuitum, et egesta humo operies

verses.textEn: that from which you were relieved. For the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp, in order to rescue you, and to deliver your enemies to you. And so, let your camp be holy, and let nothing filthy appear within it, lest he abandon you.
verses.textLa: quo revelatus es (Dominus enim Deus tuus ambulat in medio castrorum, ut eruat te, et tradat tibi inimicos tuos) et sint castra tua sancta, et nihil in eis appareat fœditatis ne derelinquat te.

verses.textEn: You shall not deliver a servant who has fled to you to his master.
verses.textLa: Non trades servum domino suo, qui ad te confugerit.

verses.textEn: He shall live with you in a place that pleases him, and he shall rest in one of your cities. You shall not grieve him.
verses.textLa: Habitabit tecum in loco, qui ei placuerit, et in una urbium tuarum requiescet: ne contristes eum.

verses.textEn: There shall be no prostitutes among the daughters of Israel, nor anyone among the sons of Israel who visits a prostitute.
verses.textLa: Non erit meretrix de filiabus Israel, nec scortator de filiis Israel.

verses.textEn: You shall not offer money from a prostitute, nor the price of a dog, in the house of the Lord your God, no matter what you may have vowed. For both of these are an abomination with the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Non offeres mercedem prostibuli, nec pretium canis in domo Domini Dei tui, quidquid illud est quod voveris: quia abominatio est utrumque apud Dominum Deum tuum.

verses.textEn: You shall not lend money, or grain, or anything else at all, to your brother at interest,
verses.textLa: Non fœnerabis fratri tuo ad usuram pecuniam, nec fruges, nec quamlibet aliam rem:

verses.textEn: but only to a foreigner. For you shall lend to your brother whatever he needs without interest, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all your works in the land, which you shall enter so as to possess it.
verses.textLa: sed alieno. Fratri autem tuo absque usura id, quo indiget, commodabis: ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere tuo in Terra, ad quam ingredieris possidendam.

verses.textEn: When you have made a vow to the Lord your God, you shall not be late in paying it. For the Lord your God demands it. And if you delay, it shall be imputed to you as a sin.
verses.textLa: Cum votum voveris Domino Deo tuo, non tardabis reddere: quia requiret illud Dominus Deus tuus. Et si moratus fueris, reputabitur tibi in peccatum.

verses.textEn: If you are not willing to make a promise, then it shall be without sin.
verses.textLa: Si nolueris polliceri, absque peccato eris.

verses.textEn: But as soon as it has departed from your lips, you shall observe and do just as you have promised to the Lord your God and just as you have spoken by your own free will and with your own mouth.
verses.textLa: Quod autem semel egressum est de labiis tuis, observabis, et facies sicut promisisti Domino Deo tuo, et propria voluntate et ore tuo locutus es.

verses.textEn: Upon entering your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you please. But you may not carry any out with you.
verses.textLa: Ingressus vineam proximi tui, comede uvas quantum tibi placuerit: foras autem ne efferas tecum.

verses.textEn: If you enter into your friend’s grain field, you may break off the ears, and rub them in your hand, but you may not reap them with a sickle.”
verses.textLa: Si intraveris in segetem amici tui, franges spicas, et manu conteres: falce autem non metes.

verses.textEn: “If a man takes a wife, and he has her, and she does not find favor before his eyes because of some vileness, then he shall write a bill of divorce, and he shall give it to her hand, and he shall dismiss her from his house.
verses.textLa: Si acceperit homo uxorem, et habuerit eam, et non invenerit gratiam ante oculos eius propter aliquam fœditatem: scribet libellum repudii, et dabit in manu illius, et dimittet eam de domo sua.

verses.textEn: And when, having departed, she has married another,
verses.textLa: Cumque egressa alterum maritum duxerit,

verses.textEn: and if he likewise hates her, and has given her a bill of divorce, and has dismissed her from his house, or if indeed he has died,
verses.textLa: et ille quoque oderit eam, dederitque ei libellum repudii, et dimiserit de domo sua, vel certe mortuus fuerit:

verses.textEn: then the former husband cannot take her back as a wife. For she has been polluted and has become abominable in the sight of the Lord. Otherwise, you may cause your land, which the Lord your God will deliver to you as a possession, to sin.
verses.textLa: non poterit prior maritus recipere eam in uxorem: quia polluta est, et abominabilis facta est coram Domino: ne peccare facias Terram tuam, quam Dominus Deus tuus tradiderit tibi possidendam.

verses.textEn: When a man has recently taken a wife, he shall not go out to war, nor shall any public office be enjoined upon him. Instead, he shall be free at home without guilt, so that for one year he may rejoice with his wife.
verses.textLa: Cum acceperit homo nuper uxorem, non procedet ad bellum, nec ei quippiam necessitatis iniungetur publicæ, sed vacabit absque culpa domi suæ, ut uno anno lætetur cum uxore sua.

verses.textEn: You shall not accept an upper or lower millstone as collateral. For then he will have placed his life with you.
verses.textLa: Non accipies loco pignoris inferiorem, et superiorem molam: quia animam suam opposuit tibi.

verses.textEn: If a man has been caught soliciting his brother among the sons of Israel, and selling him in order to receive a price, then he shall be put to death. And so shall you take away the evil from your midst.
verses.textLa: Si deprehensus fuerit homo solicitans fratrem suum de filiis Israel, et vendito eo acceperit pretium, interficietur, et auferes malum de medio tui.

verses.textEn: Observe diligently, lest you incur the wound of leprosy. But you shall do whatever the priests of the Levitical stock shall teach you to do, according to what I have instructed them. And you shall fulfill it carefully.
verses.textLa: Observa diligenter ne incurras plagam lepræ, sed facies quæcumque docuerint te sacerdotes Levitici generis iuxta id, quod præcepi eis, et imple sollicite.

verses.textEn: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam, along the way, as you were departing from Egypt.
verses.textLa: Mementote quæ fecerit Dominus Deus vester Mariæ in via cum egrederemini de Ægypto.

verses.textEn: When you require from your neighbor anything that he owes to you, you shall not enter into his house in order to take away the collateral.
verses.textLa: Cum repetes a proximo tuo rem aliquam, quam debet tibi, non ingredieris domum eius ut pignus auferas:

verses.textEn: Instead, you shall stand outside, and he will carry out to you what he has.
verses.textLa: sed stabis foris, et ille tibi proferet quod habuerit.

verses.textEn: But if he is poor, then the collateral shall not remain with you through the night.
verses.textLa: Sin autem pauper est, non pernoctabit apud te pignus,

verses.textEn: Instead, you shall return it to him promptly, before the setting of the sun, so that, sleeping in his own garment, he may bless you, and you may have justice in the presence of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: sed statim reddes ei ante solis occasum: ut dormiens in vestimento suo, benedicat tibi, et habeas iustitiam coram Domino Deo tuo.

verses.textEn: You shall not refuse the pay of the indigent and the poor, whether he is your brother, or he is a new arrival who dwells with you in the land and is within your gates.
verses.textLa: Non negabis mercedem indigentis, et pauperis fratris tui, sive advenæ, qui tecum moratur in terra, et intra portas tuas est:

verses.textEn: Instead, you shall pay him the price of his labor on the same day, before the setting of the sun. For he is poor, and with it he sustains his life. Otherwise, he may cry out against you to the Lord, and it would be charged to you as a sin.
verses.textLa: sed eadem die reddes ei pretium laboris sui ante solis occasum, quia pauper est, et ex eo sustentat animam suam: ne clamet contra te ad Dominum, et reputetur tibi in peccatum.

verses.textEn: The fathers shall not be put to death on behalf of the sons, nor the sons on behalf of the fathers, but each one shall die for his own sin.
verses.textLa: Non occidentur patres pro filiis, nec filii pro patribus, sed unusquisque pro peccato suo morietur.

verses.textEn: You shall not pervert the judgment of the new arrival or the orphan, nor shall you take away the widow’s garment as collateral.
verses.textLa: Non pervertes iudicium advenæ et pupilli, nec auferes pignoris loco viduæ vestimentum.

verses.textEn: Remember that you served in Egypt, and that the Lord your God rescued you from there. Therefore, I am instructing you to act in this way.
verses.textLa: Memento quod servieris in Ægypto, et eruerit te Dominus Deus tuus inde. Idcirco præcipio tibi ut facias hanc rem.

verses.textEn: When you have reaped the grain in your field, and, having forgotten, you leave behind a sheaf, you shall not return to take it away. Instead, you shall permit the new arrival, and the orphan, and the widow to take it away, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the works of your hands.
verses.textLa: Quando messueris segetem in agro tuo, et oblitus manipulum reliqueris, non reverteris ut tollas illum: sed advenam, et pupillum, et viduam auferre patieris, ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere manuum tuarum.

verses.textEn: If you have gathered the fruit of your olive trees, you shall not return in order to gather whatever may remain on the trees. Instead, you shall leave it behind for the new arrival, the orphan, and the widow.
verses.textLa: Si fruges collegeris olivarum, quidquid remanserit in arboribus, non reverteris ut colligas: sed relinques advenæ, pupillo, ac viduæ.

verses.textEn: If you harvest the vintage of your vineyard, you shall not gather the remaining clusters. Instead, they shall fall to the use of the stranger, the orphan, and the widow.
verses.textLa: Si vindemiaveris vineam tuam, non colliges remanentes racemos, sed cedent in usus advenæ, pupilli, ac viduæ.

verses.textEn: Remember that you also served in Egypt, and so, for this reason, I am instructing you to act in this way.”
verses.textLa: Memento quod et tu servieris in Ægypto, et idcirco præcipio tibi ut facias hanc rem.

verses.textEn: “If there is a case between persons, and they apply to the judges, they shall give the palm of justice to the one whom they perceive to be just, and they shall condemn of impiety the one who is impious.
verses.textLa: Si fuerit causa inter aliquos, et interpellaverint iudices: quem iustum esse perspexerint, illi iustitiæ palmam dabunt: quem impium, condemnabunt impietatis.

verses.textEn: But if they see that the one who has sinned is worthy of stripes, they shall prostrate him and cause him to be beaten before them. According to the measure of the sin, so shall the measure of the stripes be.
verses.textLa: Sin autem eum, qui peccavit, dignum viderint plagis: prosternent, et coram se facient verberari. Pro mensura peccati erit et plagarum modus:

verses.textEn: Even so, these shall not exceed the number of forty. Otherwise, your brother may depart, having been wounded shamefully before your eyes.
verses.textLa: ita dumtaxat, ut quadragenarium numerum non excedant: ne fœde laceratus ante oculos tuos abeat frater tuus.

verses.textEn: You shall not muzzle an ox as it is treading out your crops in the field.
verses.textLa: Non ligabis os bovis terentis in area fruges tuas.

verses.textEn: When brothers are living together, and one of them dies without children, the wife of the deceased shall not marry another. Instead, his brother shall take her, and he shall raise up offspring for his brother.
verses.textLa: Quando habitaverint fratres simul, et unus ex eis absque liberis mortuus fuerit, uxor defuncti non nubet alteri: sed accipiet eam frater eius, et suscitabit semen fratris sui:

verses.textEn: And the first son from her, he shall call by his brother’s name, so that his name will not be abolished from Israel.
verses.textLa: et primogenitum ex ea filium nomine illius appellabit, ut non deleatur nomen eius ex Israel.

verses.textEn: But if he is not willing to take his brother’s wife, who by law must go to him, the woman shall go to the gate of the city, and she shall call upon those greater by birth, and she shall say: ‘The brother of my husband is not willing to raise up his brother’s name in Israel; nor will he join with me.’
verses.textLa: Sin autem noluerit accipere uxorem fratris sui, quæ ei lege debetur, perget mulier ad portam civitatis, et interpellabit maiores natu, dicetque: Non vult frater viri mei suscitare nomen fratris sui in Israel: nec me in coniugem sumere.

verses.textEn: And immediately, they shall summon him to be sent, and they shall question him. If he responds, ‘I am not willing to accept her as a wife,’
verses.textLa: Statimque accersiri eum facient, et interrogabunt. Si responderit: Nolo eam uxorem accipere:

verses.textEn: then the woman shall approach him in the sight of the elders, and she shall remove his shoe from his foot, and she shall spit in his face, and she shall say: ‘So shall it be done to the man who was not willing to build up his brother’s house.’
verses.textLa: accedet mulier ad eum coram senioribus, et tollet calceamentum de pede eius, spuetque in faciem illius, et dicet: Sic fiet homini, qui non ædificat domum fratris sui.

verses.textEn: And his name shall be called in Israel: The House of the Unshod.
verses.textLa: Et vocabitur nomen illius in Israel, Domus discalceati.

verses.textEn: If two men have a conflict between themselves, and one begins to do violence to the other, and if the other’s wife, wanting to rescue her husband from the hand of the stronger one, extends her hand and grasps him by his private parts,
verses.textLa: Si habuerint inter se iurgium viri duo, et unus contra alterum rixari cœperit, volensque uxor alterius eruere virum suum de manu fortioris, miseritque manum, et apprehenderit verenda eius:

verses.textEn: then you shall cut off her hand. Neither shall you weep over her with any mercy.
verses.textLa: abscides manum illius, nec flecteris super eam ulla misericordia.

verses.textEn: You shall not have differing weights, greater and lesser, in your bag.
verses.textLa: Non habebis in sacculo diversa pondera, maius et minus:

verses.textEn: Neither shall there be in your house a greater and a lesser measure.
verses.textLa: nec erit in domo tua modius maior et minor.

verses.textEn: You shall have a just and a true weight, and your measure shall be equal and true, so that you may live for a long time upon the land, which the Lord your God will give to you.
verses.textLa: Pondus habebis iustum et verum, et modius æqualis et verus erit tibi: ut multo vivas tempore super Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi.

verses.textEn: For the Lord your God abominates him who does these things, and he loathes all injustice.
verses.textLa: Abominatur enim Dominus tuus eum, qui facit hæc, et aversatur omnem iniustitiam.

verses.textEn: Remember what Amalek did to you, along the way, when you were departing from Egypt:
verses.textLa: Memento quæ fecerit tibi Amalec in via quando egrediebaris ex Ægypto:

verses.textEn: how he met you and cut down the stragglers of the troops, who were sitting down, exhausted, when you were consumed by hunger and hardship, and how he did not fear God.
verses.textLa: quomodo occurrerit tibi: et extremos agminis tui, qui lassi residebant, ceciderit, quando tu eras fame et labore confectus, et non timuerit Deum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, when the Lord your God will give you rest, and you will have subdued all the surrounding nations, in the land which he has promised to you, you shall delete his name from under heaven. Take care not to forget this.”
verses.textLa: Cum ergo Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi requiem, et subiecerit cunctas per circuitum nationes in Terra, quam tibi pollicitus est: delebis nomen eius sub cælo. Cave ne obliviscaris.

verses.textEn: “And when you will have entered into the land which the Lord your God will give to you to possess, and when you will have obtained it and are living within it:
verses.textLa: Cumque intraveris Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus tibi daturus est possidendam, et obtinueris eam, atque habitaveris in ea:

verses.textEn: you shall take the first of all your crops, and place them in a basket, and you shall travel to the place which the Lord your God will choose, so that his name may be invoked there.
verses.textLa: tolles de cunctis frugibus tuis primitias, et pones in cartallo, pergesque ad locum, quem Dominus Deus tuus elegerit, ut ibi invocetur nomen eius:

verses.textEn: And you shall approach the priest who will be in those days, and you shall say to him: ‘I profess this day, before the Lord your God, that I have entered into the land about which he swore to our fathers that he would give it to us.’
verses.textLa: accedesque ad sacerdotem, qui fuerit in diebus illis, et dices ad eum: Profiteor hodie coram Domino Deo tuo, quod ingressus sum in Terram, pro qua iuravit patribus nostris, ut daret eam nobis.

verses.textEn: And the priest, taking up the basket from your hand, shall place it before the altar of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Suscipiensque sacerdos cartallum de manu tua, ponet ante altare Domini Dei tui:

verses.textEn: And you shall say, in the sight of the Lord your God: ‘The Syrian pursued my father, who descended into Egypt, and he sojourned there in a very small number, and he increased into a great and strong nation and into an innumerable multitude.
verses.textLa: et loqueris in conspectu Domini Dei tui: Syrus persequebatur patrem meum, qui descendit in Ægyptum, et ibi peregrinatus est in paucissimo numero: crevitque in gentem magnam ac robustam et infinitæ multitudinis.

verses.textEn: And the Egyptians afflicted us, and they persecuted us, imposing upon us the most grievous burdens.
verses.textLa: Afflixeruntque nos Ægyptii, et persecuti sunt imponentes onera gravissima:

verses.textEn: And we cried out to the Lord, the God of our fathers. He heard us, and he looked with favor upon our humiliation, and hardship, and distress.
verses.textLa: et clamavimus ad Dominum Deum patrum nostrorum: qui exaudivit nos, et respexit humilitatem nostram, et laborem, atque angustiam:

verses.textEn: And he led us away from Egypt, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, with a mighty terror, with signs and wonders.
verses.textLa: et eduxit nos de Ægypto in manu forti, et brachio extento, in ingenti pavore, in signis atque portentis:

verses.textEn: And he led us into this place, and he delivered to us the land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.textLa: et introduxit ad locum istum, et tradidit nobis Terram lacte et melle manantem.

verses.textEn: And because of this, I now offer the first fruits of the land which the Lord has given to me.’ And you shall leave them in the sight of the Lord your God, and you shall adore the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Et idcirco nunc offero primitias frugum Terræ, quam Dominus dedit mihi. Et dimittes eas in conspectu Domini Dei tui, et adorato Domino Deo tuo.

verses.textEn: And you shall feast on all the good things which the Lord your God will give to you and to your house: you, and the Levite, and the new arrival who is with you.
verses.textLa: Et epulaberis in omnibus bonis, quæ Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi, et domui tuæ, tu et Levites, et advena qui tecum est.

verses.textEn: When you will have completed the tithing of all your crops, in the third year of tithes, you shall give it to the Levite, and to the new arrival, and to the orphan, and to the widow, so that they may eat within your gates and be satisfied.
verses.textLa: Quando compleveris decimam cunctarum frugum tuarum, anno decimarum tertio dabis Levitæ, et advenæ, et pupillo et viduæ, ut comedant intra portas tuas, et saturentur.

verses.textEn: And you shall say, in the sight of the Lord your God: ‘I have taken what was sanctified from my house, and I have given it to the Levite, and to the new arrival, and to the orphan and the widow, just as you have commanded me. I have not transgressed your commandments, nor have I forgotten your precepts.
verses.textLa: Loquerisque in conspectu Domini Deo tui: Abstuli quod sanctificatum est de domo mea, et dedi illud Levitæ et advenæ, et pupillo ac viduæ, sicut iussisti mihi: non præterivi mandata tua, nec sum oblitus imperii tui.

verses.textEn: I have not eaten from these things in my grief, nor have I separated them due to any kind of uncleanness, nor have I expended any of these things in funerals. I have obeyed the voice of the Lord my God, and I have done all things just as you have instructed me.
verses.textLa: Non comedi ex eis in luctu meo, nec separavi ea in qualibet immunditia, nec expendi ex his quidquam in re funebri. Obedivi voci Domini Dei mei, et feci omnia sicut præcepisti mihi.

verses.textEn: Look with favor from your sanctuary and from your lofty habitation amid the heavens, and bless your people Israel and the land which you have given to us, just as you swore to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.’
verses.textLa: Respice de sanctuario tuo, et de excelso cælorum habitaculo, et benedic populo tuo Israel, et Terræ, quam dedisti nobis, sicut iurasti patribus nostris, terræ lacte et melle mananti.

verses.textEn: Today the Lord your God has instructed you to carry out these commandments and judgments, and to keep and fulfill them, with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.textLa: Hodie Dominus Deus tuus præcepit tibi ut facias mandata hæc atque iudicia: et custodias et impleas ex toto corde tuo, et ex tota anima tua.

verses.textEn: Today, you have chosen the Lord to be your God, so that you may walk in his ways, and keep his ceremonies and commandments and judgments, and obey his command.
verses.textLa: Dominum elegisti hodie, ut sit tibi Deus, et ambules in viis eius, et custodias ceremonias illius, et mandata atque iudicia, et obedias eius imperio.

verses.textEn: Today, the Lord has chosen you, so that you may be his particular people, just as he has spoken to you, and so that you may keep all his precepts,
verses.textLa: Et Dominus elegit te hodie ut sis ei populus peculiaris, sicut locutus est tibi, et custodias omnia præcepta illius:

verses.textEn: and so that he may cause you to be more exalted than all the nations which he has created, for the sake of his own praise and name and glory, in order that you may be a holy people for the Lord your God, just as he has spoken.”
verses.textLa: et faciat te excelsiorem cunctis gentibus quas creavit, in laudem, et nomen, et gloriam suam: ut sis populus sanctus Domini Dei tui, sicut locutus est.

verses.textEn: Then Moses and the elders of Israel instructed the people, saying: “Keep each commandment that I instruct to you this day.
verses.textLa: Præcepit autem Moyses et seniores Israel, populo dicentes: Custodite omne mandatum quod præcipio vobis hodie.

verses.textEn: And when you have crossed over the Jordan, into the land which the Lord your God will give to you, you shall erect immense stones, and you shall coat them with plaster,
verses.textLa: Cumque transieritis Iordanem in Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, eriges ingentes lapides, et calce levigabis eos,

verses.textEn: so that you may be able to write upon them all the words of this law, when you have crossed the Jordan so as to enter into the land which the Lord your God will give to you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as he swore to your fathers.
verses.textLa: ut possis in eis scribere omnia verba legis huius, Iordane transmisso: ut introeas Terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, terram lacte et melle manantem, sicut iuravit patribus tuis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, when you have crossed over the Jordan, erect the stones, just as I instruct you to do this day, on Mount Ebal. And you shall coat them with plaster,
verses.textLa: Quando ergo transieritis Iordanem, erigite lapides, quos ego hodie præcipio vobis in monte Hebal, et levigabis eos calce:

verses.textEn: and you shall build, in that place, an altar to the Lord your God out of stones which have not been touched by iron,
verses.textLa: et ædificabis ibi altare Domino Deo tuo de lapidibus, quos ferrum non tetigit,

verses.textEn: out of stones which have not been hewn or polished. And you shall offer holocausts on it to the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: et de saxis informibus et impolitis: et offeres super eo holocausta Domino Deo tuo,

verses.textEn: And you shall immolate peace victims. And you shall eat and feast in that place, in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: et immolabis hostias pacificas, comedesque ibi, et epulaberis coram Domino Deo tuo.

verses.textEn: And you shall write upon the stones all the words of this law, plainly and clearly.”
verses.textLa: Et scribes super lapides omnia verba legis huius plane et lucide.

verses.textEn: And Moses and the priests of Levitical stock said to all of Israel: “Attend and listen, O Israel! Today you have become the people of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Dixeruntque Moyses et sacerdotes Levitici generis ad omnem Israelem: Attende, et audi Israel: Hodie factus es populus Domini Dei tui:

verses.textEn: You shall listen to his voice, and you shall do the commandments and justices, which I am entrusting to you.”
verses.textLa: audies vocem eius, et facies mandata atque iustitias, quas ego præcipio tibi.

verses.textEn: And Moses instructed the people in that day, saying:
verses.textLa: Præcepitque Moyses populo in die illo, dicens:

verses.textEn: “These shall stand upon Mount Gerizim, as a blessing to the people, when you will have crossed the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.textLa: Hi stabunt ad benedicendum populo super montem Garizim, Iordane transmisso: Simeon, Levi, Iudas, Issachar, Ioseph, et Beniamin.

verses.textEn: And in the opposite region, there shall stand upon Mount Ebal, as a curse: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
verses.textLa: Et e regione isti stabunt ad maledicendum in monte Hebal: Ruben, Gad, et Aser, et Zabulon, Dan et Nephthali.

verses.textEn: And the Levites shall pronounce and declare to all the men of Israel, with an exalted voice:
verses.textLa: Et pronunciabunt Levitæ, dicentque ad omnes viros Israel excelsa voce:

verses.textEn: Cursed be the man who makes a graven or molten idol, an abomination to the Lord, a work of the hands of its maker, and who puts it in a secret place. And all the people shall respond by saying: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus homo, qui facit sculptile et conflatile, abominationem Domini, opus manuum artificum, ponetque illud in abscondito. Et respondebit omnis populus, et dicet: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who does not honor his father and mother. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui non honorat patrem suum, et matrem. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who removes his neighbor’s landmarks. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui transfert terminos proximi sui. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who causes the blind to go astray on a journey. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui errare facit cæcum in itinere. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who subverts the judgment of the new arrival, the orphan, or the widow. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui pervertit iudicium advenæ, pupilli et viduæ. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who lies with his father’s wife, and so exposes the covering of his bed. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui dormit cum uxore patris sui, et revelat operimentum lectuli eius. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who lies with any beast. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui dormit cum omni iumento. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who lies with his sister, the daughter of his father, or of his mother. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui dormit cum sorore sua, filia patris sui, vel matris suæ. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.notes: Abraham married his half sister, Sarai (Genesis 20:12). But this occurred before God formed the covenant with Abraham, so Abraham is not accursed.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who lies with his mother-in-law. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui dormit cum socru sua. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who secretly strikes down his neighbor. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui clam percusserit proximum suum. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who accepts gifts in order to strike down the life of innocent blood. And all the people shall say: Amen.
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui accipit munera, ut percutiat animam sanguinis innocentis. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: Cursed be he who does not remain in the words of this law, and does not carry them out in deed. And all the people shall say: Amen.”
verses.textLa: Maledictus qui non permanet in sermonibus legis huius, nec eos opere perficit. Et dicet omnis populus: Amen.

verses.textEn: “So then, if you will listen to the voice of the Lord your God, so as to keep and do all of his commandments, which I instruct to you this day, the Lord your God will cause you to be more exalted than all the nations which exist upon the earth.
verses.textLa: Si autem audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, ut facias atque custodias omnia mandata eius, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, faciet te Dominus Deus tuus excelsiorem cunctis gentibus, quæ versantur in terra.

verses.textEn: And all these blessings shall come to you and take hold of you, but only if you listen to his precepts.
verses.textLa: Venientque super te universæ benedictiones istæ, et apprehendent te: si tamen præcepta eius audieris.

verses.textEn: Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed in the field.
verses.textLa: Benedictus tu in civitate, et benedictus in agro.

verses.textEn: Blessed shall be the fruit of your loins, and the fruit of your land, and the fruit of your cattle, the droves of your herds, and the folds of your sheep.
verses.textLa: Benedictus fructus ventris tui, et fructus terræ tuæ, fructusque iumentorum tuorum, greges armentorum tuorum, et caulæ ovium tuarum.
verses.notes: The word ‘ventris’ refers more generally to the generative capability of the human person; by comparison, ‘utero’ has more of the meaning of womb.

verses.textEn: Blessed shall be your barns, and blessed your storehouses.
verses.textLa: Benedicta horrea tua, et benedictæ reliquiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: Blessed shall you be entering and departing.
verses.textLa: Benedictus eris tu ingrediens et egrediens.

verses.textEn: The Lord will grant that your enemies, who rise up against you, will fall down in your sight. They will come against you by one way, and they will flee from your face by seven ways.
verses.textLa: Dabit Dominus inimicos tuos, qui consurgunt adversum te, corruentes in conspectu tuo: per unam viam venient contra te, et per septem fugient a facie tua.

verses.textEn: The Lord will send forth a blessing upon your cellars, and upon all the works of your hands. And he will bless you in the land that you shall receive.
verses.textLa: Emittet Dominus benedictionem super cellaria tua, et super omnia opera manuum tuarum: benedicetque tibi in terra, quam acceperis.

verses.textEn: The Lord will raise you up as a holy people for himself, just as he swore to you, if you will keep the commandments of the Lord your God, and walk in his ways.
verses.textLa: Suscitabit te Dominus sibi in populum sanctum, sicut iuravit tibi: si custodieris mandata Domini Dei tui, et ambulaveris in viis eius.

verses.textEn: And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord has been invoked over you, and they shall fear you.
verses.textLa: Videbuntque omnes terrarum populi quod nomen Domini invocatum sit super te, et timebunt te.

verses.textEn: The Lord will cause you to be abundant in every good thing: in the fruit of your womb, and in the fruit of your cattle, and in the fruit of your land, which the Lord swore to your fathers that he would give to you.
verses.textLa: Abundare te faciet Dominus omnibus bonis, fructu uteri tui, et fructu iumentorum tuorum, fructu terræ tuæ, quam iuravit Dominus patribus tuis ut daret tibi.

verses.textEn: The Lord will open his excellent treasury, the heavens, so that it may distribute rain in due time. And he will bless all the works of your hands. And you shall lend to many nations, but you yourself will borrow nothing from anyone.
verses.textLa: Aperiet Dominus thesaurum suum optimum, cælum, ut tribuat pluviam terræ tuæ in tempore suo: benedicetque cunctis operibus manuum tuarum. Et fœnerabis gentibus multis, et ipse a nullo fœnus accipies.

verses.textEn: And the Lord will appoint you as the head, and not as the tail. And you shall be always above, and not beneath. But only if you will listen to the commandments of the Lord your God, which I entrust to you this day, and will keep and do them,
verses.textLa: Constituet te Dominus in caput, et non in caudam: et eris semper supra, et non subter: si tamen audieris mandata Domini Dei tui quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, et custodieris et feceris,

verses.textEn: and will not turn aside from them, neither to the right, nor to the left, nor follow strange gods, nor worship them.
verses.textLa: ac non declinaveris ab eis nec ad dexteram, nec ad sinistram, nec secutus fueris deos alienos, neque colueris eos.

verses.textEn: But if you are not willing to listen to the voice of the Lord your God, so as to keep and do all his commandments and ceremonies, which I instruct to you this day, all these curses shall come to you, and take hold of you.
verses.textLa: Quod si audire nolueris vocem Domini Dei tui, ut custodias, et facias omnia mandata eius et ceremonias, quas ego præcipio tibi hodie, venient super te omnes maledictiones istæ, et apprehendent te.

verses.textEn: Cursed shall you be in the city, cursed in the field.
verses.textLa: Maledictus eris in civitate, maledictus in agro.

verses.textEn: Cursed shall be your barn, and cursed your storehouses.
verses.textLa: Maledictum horreum tuum, et maledictæ reliquiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: Cursed shall be the fruit of your loins, and the fruit of your land, the herds of your oxen, and the flocks of your sheep.
verses.textLa: Maledictus fructus ventris tui, et fructus terræ tuæ, armenta boum tuorum, et greges ovium tuarum.

verses.textEn: Cursed shall you be entering, and cursed departing.
verses.textLa: Maledictus eris ingrediens, et maledictus egrediens.

verses.textEn: The Lord will send famine and hunger upon you, and a rebuke upon all the works that you do, until he quickly crushes and perishes you, because of your very wicked innovations, by which you have forsaken me.
verses.textLa: Mittet Dominus super te famem et esuriem, et increpationem in omnia opera tua, quæ tu facies: donec conterat te, et perdat velociter, propter adinventiones tuas pessimas in quibus reliquisti me.

verses.textEn: May the Lord join a pestilence to you, until he consumes you from the land, which you shall enter so as to possess.
verses.textLa: Adiungat tibi Dominus pestilentiam, donec consumat te de terra, ad quam ingredieris possidendam.

verses.textEn: May the Lord strike you with destitution, with fever and cold, with burning and heat, and with polluted air and rot, and may he pursue you until you perish.
verses.textLa: Percutiat te Dominus egestate, febri et frigore, ardore et æstu, et aere corrupto ac rubigine, et persequatur donec pereas.

verses.textEn: May the heavens which are above you be of brass, and may the ground upon which you tread be of iron.
verses.textLa: Sit cælum, quod supra te est, æneum: et terra, quam calcas, ferrea.

verses.textEn: May the Lord give you dust instead of rain upon your land, and may ashes descend from heaven over you, until you have been wiped away.
verses.textLa: Det Dominus imbrem terræ tuæ pulverem, et de cælo descendat super te cinis, donec conteraris.

verses.textEn: May the Lord hand you over to fall before your enemies. May you go forth against them by one way, and flee by seven ways, and may you be scattered across all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.textLa: Tradat te Dominus corruentem ante hostes tuos. Per unam viam egrediaris contra eos, et per septem fugias, et dispergaris per omnia regna terræ.

verses.textEn: And may your carcass be food for all the flying things of the air and the wild beasts of the land, and may there be no one to drive them away.
verses.textLa: Sitque cadaver tuum in escam cunctis volatilibus cæli, et bestiis terræ, et non sit qui abigat.

verses.textEn: May the Lord strike you with the ulcer of Egypt, and may he strike the part of your body, through which the dung goes out, with disease as well as itch, so much so that you are unable to be cured.
verses.textLa: Percutiat te Dominus ulcere Ægypti, et partem corporis, per quam stercora egeruntur, scabie quoque et prurigine: ita ut curari nequeas.

verses.textEn: May the Lord strike you with frenzy and blindness and a madness of the mind.
verses.textLa: Percutiat te Dominus amentia et cæcitate ac furore mentis,

verses.textEn: And may you grope at midday, just as a blind man is accustomed to grope in darkness, and may your paths not be straight. And at all times may you suffer slander and be oppressed with violence, and may you have no one who may free you.
verses.textLa: et palpes in meridie sicut palpare solet cæcus in tenebris, et non dirigas vias tuas. Omnique tempore calumniam sustineas, et opprimaris violentia, nec habeas qui liberet te.

verses.textEn: May you take a wife, though another sleeps with her. May you build a house, but not live within it. May you plant a vineyard, and not gather its vintage.
verses.textLa: Uxorem accipias, et alius dormiat cum ea. Domum ædifices, et non habites in ea. Plantes vineam, et non vindemies eam.

verses.textEn: May your ox be immolated before you, though you do not eat from it. May your donkey be seized in your sight, and not restored to you. May your sheep be given to your enemies, and may there be no one who may help you.
verses.textLa: Bos tuus immoletur coram te, et non comedas ex eo. Asinus tuus rapiatur in conspectu tuo, et non reddatur tibi. Oves tuæ dentur inimicis tuis, et non sit qui te adiuvet.

verses.textEn: May your sons and your daughters be handed over to another people, as your eyes watch and languish at the sight of them throughout the day, and may there be no strength in your hand.
verses.textLa: Filii tui et filiæ tuæ tradantur alteri populo, videntibus oculis tuis, et deficientibus ad conspectum eorum tota die, et non sit fortitudo in manu tua.

verses.textEn: May a people you do not know eat the fruits of your land and of all your labors. And may you continually suffer from slander and oppression every day.
verses.textLa: Fructus terræ tuæ, et omnes labores tuos comedat populus, quem ignoras: et sis semper calumniam sustinens, et oppressus cunctis diebus,

verses.textEn: And may you be stupefied at the terror of the things your eyes will see.
verses.textLa: et stupens ad terrorem eorum quæ videbunt oculi tui.

verses.textEn: May the Lord strike you with a very grievous ulcer in the knees and in the legs, and may you be unable to attain health, from the sole of the foot to the top of the head.
verses.textLa: Percutiat te Dominus ulcere pessimo in genibus et in suris, sanarique non possis a planta pedis usque ad verticem tuum.

verses.textEn: May the Lord lead you and your king, whom you will have appointed over yourself, into a nation which you and your fathers have not known. And there you will serve foreign gods, of wood and of stone.
verses.textLa: Ducet te Dominus, et regem tuum, quem constitueris super te, in gentem, quam ignoras tu et patres tui: et servies ibi diis alienis, ligno et lapidi.

verses.textEn: And you will become nothing but a proverb and a fable to all the peoples to whom the Lord will lead you.
verses.textLa: Et eris perditus in proverbium ac fabulam omnibus populis, ad quos te introduxerit Dominus.

verses.textEn: You will sow much seed upon the ground, but you will harvest little. For the locusts will devour everything.
verses.textLa: Sementem multam iacies in terram, et modicum congregabis: quia locustæ devorabunt omnia.
