verses.textEn: You will dig and plant a vineyard, but you will not drink the wine, nor gather anything at all from it. For it will be devastated by worms.
verses.textLa: Vineam plantabis, et fodies: et vinum non bibes, nec colliges ex ea quippiam: quoniam vastabitur vermibus.

verses.textEn: You will have olive trees in all your borders, but you will not be anointed with the oil. For the olives will fall off and perish.
verses.textLa: Olivas habebis in omnibus terminis tuis, et non ungeris oleo: quia defluent, et peribunt.

verses.textEn: You will conceive sons and daughters, and you will not enjoy them. For they will be led into captivity.
verses.textLa: Filios generabis et filias, et non frueris eis: quoniam ducentur in captivitatem.

verses.textEn: Rot will consume all the trees, as well as the fruits of your land.
verses.textLa: Omnes arbores tuas et fruges terræ tuæ rubigo consumet.

verses.textEn: The new arrival who lives with you in the land will ascend over you, and be higher. But you will descend, and be lower.
verses.textLa: Advena, qui tecum versatur in terra, ascendet super te, eritque sublimior: tu autem descendes, et eris inferior.

verses.textEn: He will lend to you, and you will not lend to him. He will be as the head, and you will be as the tail.
verses.textLa: Ipse fœnerabit tibi, et tu non fœnerabis ei. Ipse erit in caput, et tu eris in caudam.

verses.textEn: And all these curses shall come to you, and shall pursue you, and shall take hold of you, until you pass away, because you would not listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and you would not serve his commandments and ceremonies, which he has instructed to you.
verses.textLa: Et venient super te omnes maledictiones istæ, et persequentes apprehendent te, donec intereas: quia non audisti vocem Domini Dei tui, nec servasti mandata eius et ceremonias, quas præcepit tibi.

verses.textEn: And there will be the signs and portents with you, and with your offspring, forever.
verses.textLa: Et erunt in te signa atque prodigia, et in semine tuo usque in sempiternum:

verses.textEn: Because you did not serve the Lord your God, with gladness and a joyful heart, over the abundance of all things.
verses.textLa: eo quod non servieris Domino Deo tuo in gaudio, cordisque lætitia, propter rerum omnium abundantiam:

verses.textEn: You will serve your enemy, whom the Lord will send to you, in hunger and thirst and nakedness, and in destitution of all things. And he will place an iron yoke upon your neck, until he has crushed you.
verses.textLa: servies inimico tuo, quem immittet tibi Dominus, in fame, et siti, et nuditate, et omni penuria: et ponet iugum ferreum super cervicem tuam, donec te conterat.

verses.textEn: The Lord will lead over you a nation from far away, even from the furthest parts of the earth, like an eagle flying with great force, whose language you are not able to understand:
verses.textLa: Adducet Dominus super te gentem de longinquo, et de extremis terræ finibus in similitudinem aquilæ volantis cum impetu: cuius linguam intelligere non possis:

verses.textEn: a very insolent nation, which will show no deference to elders, nor take pity on little ones.
verses.textLa: gentem procacissimam, quæ non deferat seni, nec misereatur parvuli,

verses.textEn: And he will devour the fruit of your cattle, and the fruits of your land, until you have passed away, without leaving behind you wheat, or wine, or oil, or herds of oxen, or flocks of sheep: until he utterly destroys you.
verses.textLa: et devoret fructum iumentorum tuorum, ac fruges Terræ tuæ: donec intereas, et non relinquat tibi triticum, vinum, et oleum, armenta boum, et greges ovium: donec te disperdat,

verses.textEn: And he will crush you in all your cities. And your strong and lofty walls, in which you trusted, will be destroyed throughout all your land. You will be besieged within your gates throughout all your land, which the Lord your God will give to you.
verses.textLa: et conterat in cunctis urbibus tuis, et destruantur muri tui firmi atque sublimes, in quibus habebas fiduciam in omni Terra tua. Obsideberis intra portas tuas in omni Terra tua, quam dabit tibi Dominus Deus tuus:

verses.textEn: And you will eat the fruit of your womb, and the flesh of your sons and of your daughters, which the Lord your God will give to you, due to the anguish and devastation with which your enemy will oppress you.
verses.textLa: et comedes fructum uteri tui, et carnes filiorum tuorum et filiarum tuarum, quas dederit tibi Dominus Deus tuus, in angustia et vastitate qua opprimet te hostis tuus.

verses.textEn: The man who is pampered and very self-indulgent among you will vie with his own brother, and with the wife who lies at his bosom,
verses.textLa: Homo delicatus in te, et luxuriosus valde, invidebit fratri suo, et uxori, quæ cubat in sinu suo,

verses.textEn: lest he give to them from the flesh of his sons, which he will eat. For he has nothing else due to the siege and the destitution, with which your enemies will devastate you within all your gates.
verses.textLa: ne det eis de carnibus filiorum suorum, quas comedet: eo quod nihil aliud habeat in obsidione et penuria, qua vastaverint te inimici tui intra omnes portas tuas.

verses.textEn: The tender and pampered woman, who would not walk upon the soil, nor step firmly with her foot due to her very great softness and tenderness, will vie with her husband, who lies at her bosom, over the flesh of son and of daughter,
verses.textLa: Tenera mulier et delicata, quæ super terram ingredi non valebat, nec pedis vestigium figere propter mollitiem et teneritudinem nimiam, invidebit viro suo, qui cubat in sinu eius, super filii et filiæ carnibus,

verses.textEn: and over the filth of the afterbirth, which goes forth from between her thighs, and over the children who are born in the same hour. For they will eat them secretly, due to the scarcity of all things during the siege and the devastation, with which your enemy will oppress you within your gates.
verses.textLa: et illuvie secundarum, quæ egrediuntur de medio feminum eius, et super liberis qui eadem hora nati sunt. Comedent enim eos clam propter rerum omnium penuriam in obsidione et vastitate, qua opprimet te inimicus tuus intra portas tuas.

verses.textEn: If you will not keep and do all the words of this law, which have been written in this volume, and fear his glorious and terrible name, that is, the Lord your God,
verses.textLa: Nisi custodieris, et feceris omnia verba legis huius, quæ scripta sunt in hoc volumine, et timueris nomen eius gloriosum et terribile, hoc est, Dominum Deum tuum:

verses.textEn: then the Lord will increase your plagues, and the plagues of your offspring, plagues great and long-lasting, infirmities very grievous and continuous.
verses.textLa: augebit Dominus plagas tuas, et plagas seminis tui, plagas magnas et perseverantes, infirmitates pessimas et perpetuas.

verses.textEn: And he will turn back upon you all the afflictions of Egypt, which you fear, and these will cling to you.
verses.textLa: Et convertet in te omnes afflictiones Ægypti, quas timuisti, et adhærebunt tibi:

verses.textEn: In addition, the Lord will lead over you all the diseases and plagues that are not written in the volume of this law, until he crushes you.
verses.textLa: Insuper et universos languores, et plagas, quæ non sunt scriptæ in volumine legis huius, inducet Dominus super te, donec te conterat:

verses.textEn: And you will remain few in number, though you were before like the stars of heaven in multitude, because you would not listen to the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: et remanebitis pauci numero, qui prius eratis sicut astra cæli præ multitudine, quoniam non audisti vocem Domini Dei tui.

verses.textEn: And just as before, when the Lord rejoiced over you, doing good for you and multiplying you, so shall he rejoice, scattering and overturning you, so as to take you away from the land, which you shall enter in order to possess.
verses.textLa: Et sicut ante lætatus est Dominus super vos, bene vobis faciens, vosque multiplicans: sic lætabitur disperdens vos atque subvertens, ut auferamini de Terra, ad quam ingredieris possidendam.

verses.textEn: The Lord will disperse you among all the peoples, from the heights of the earth to its furthest limits. And there you will serve foreign gods of wood and of stone, which you and your fathers did not know.
verses.textLa: Disperget te Dominus in omnes populos a summitate terræ usque ad terminos eius: et servies ibi diis alienis, quos et tu ignoras et patres tui, lignis et lapidibus.

verses.textEn: Similarly, you will not have tranquility, even within those nations, nor will there be any rest for the steps of your feet. For the Lord will give to you in that place a fearful heart, and failing eyes, and a life consumed with grieving.
verses.textLa: In gentibus quoque illis non quiesces, neque erit requies vestigio pedis tui. Dabit enim tibi Dominus ibi cor pavidum, et deficientes oculos, et animam consumptam mœrore:

verses.textEn: And your life will be as if it were hanging before you. You will be afraid night and day, and you will not have confidence in your own life.
verses.textLa: Et erit vita tua quasi pendens ante te. Timebis nocte et die, et non credes vitæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: In the morning you will say, ‘Who will grant evening to me?’ and at evening, ‘Who will grant morning to me?’ because of the dread of your heart, with which you will be terrified, and because of those things that you will see with your eyes.
verses.textLa: Mane dices: Quis mihi det vesperum? Et vespere: Quis mihi det mane? Propter cordis tui formidinem, qua terreberis, et propter ea, quæ tuis videbis oculis.

verses.textEn: The Lord will lead you back into Egypt with a fleet of ships, along the way, about which he said to you that you would not see it again. In that place, you will be put up for sale as men and women servants to your enemies, but there will be no one willing to buy you.”
verses.textLa: Reducet te Dominus classibus in Ægyptum per viam, de qua dixit tibi ut eam amplius non videres. Ibi venderis inimicis tuis in servos et ancillas, et non erit qui emat.

verses.textEn: These are the words of the covenant which the Lord instructed Moses to form with the sons of Israel in the land of Moab, beside that covenant which he struck with them at Horeb.
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt verba fœderis quod præcepit Dominus Moysi ut feriret cum filiis Israel in Terra Moab: præter illud fœdus, quod cum eis pepigit in Horeb.

verses.textEn: And Moses called all of Israel, and he said to them: “You have seen all the things that the Lord has done in your sight in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to his entire land:
verses.textLa: Vocavitque Moyses omnem Israel, et dixit ad eos: Vos vidistis universa, quæ fecit Dominus coram vobis in Terra Ægypti Pharaoni, et omnibus servis eius, universæque terræ illius,

verses.textEn: the great trials, which your eyes have seen, those immense signs and wonders.
verses.textLa: tentationes magnas, quas viderunt oculi tui, signa illa, portentaque ingentia,

verses.textEn: But the Lord has not given you an understanding heart, and seeing eyes, and ears that are able to hear, even to this present day.
verses.textLa: et non dedit vobis Dominus cor intelligens, et oculos videntes, et aures quæ possunt audire, usque in præsentem diem.

verses.textEn: He led you for forty years through the desert. Your garments have not been worn out, nor have the shoes on your feet been consumed by age.
verses.textLa: Adduxit vos quadraginta annis per desertum: non sunt attrita vestimenta vestra, nec calceamenta pedum vestrorum vetustate consumpta sunt.

verses.textEn: You did not eat bread, nor did you drink wine or liquor, so that you would know that I am the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Panem non comedistis, vinum et siceram non bibistis: ut sciretis quia ego sum Dominus Deus vester.

verses.textEn: And you arrived at this place. And Sihon, the king of Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan, went out to meet us in battle. And we struck them down.
verses.textLa: Et venistis ad hunc locum: egressusque est Sehon rex Hesebon, et Og rex Basan, occurrentes nobis ad pugnam. Et percussimus eos,

verses.textEn: And we took their land and delivered it as a possession to Ruben and to Gad, and to half of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: et tulimus terram eorum, ac tradidimus possidendam Ruben et Gad, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse.

verses.textEn: Therefore, keep the words of this covenant, and fulfill them, so that you may understand all that you are doing.
verses.textLa: Custodite ergo verba pacti huius, et implete ea: ut intelligatis universa quæ facitis.

verses.textEn: Today, you all stand in the sight of the Lord your God: your leaders, and tribes, and those greater by birth, and teachers, all the people of Israel,
verses.textLa: Vos statis hodie cuncti coram Domino Deo vestro, principes vestri, et tribus, ac maiores natu, atque doctores, omnis populus Israel,

verses.textEn: your children and wives, and the new arrival who dwells with you in the camp, aside from those who cut wood, and those who bring water,
verses.textLa: liberi et uxores vestræ, et advena qui tecum moratur in castris, exceptis lignorum cæsoribus, et his, qui comportant aquas:

verses.textEn: so that you may cross into the covenant of the Lord your God, and into the oath which the Lord your God strikes with you today.
verses.textLa: ut transeas in fœdere Domini Dei tui, et in iureiurando quod hodie Dominus Deus tuus percutit tecum:

verses.textEn: So shall he raise you up as a people to himself, and so shall he be your God, just as he has spoken to you, and just as he swore to your fathers: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.textLa: ut suscitet te sibi in populum, et ipse sit Deus tuus sicut locutus est tibi, et sicut iuravit patribus tuis, Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob.

verses.textEn: And I am not forming this covenant and confirm these oaths with you alone,
verses.textLa: Nec vobis solis ego hoc fœdus ferio, et hæc iuramenta confirmo,

verses.textEn: but with all those who are present as well as those who are absent.
verses.textLa: sed cunctis præsentibus et absentibus.

verses.textEn: For you know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we passed through the midst of nations. And when passing through them,
verses.textLa: Vos enim nostis quomodo habitaverimus in Terra Ægypti, et quo modo transierimus per medium nationum, quas transeuntes

verses.textEn: you saw their abominations and filth, that is, their idols of wood and of stone, of silver and of gold, which they worshipped,
verses.textLa: vidistis abominationes et sordes, id est, idola eorum, lignum et lapidem, argentum et aurum, quæ colebant.

verses.textEn: so that there would not be among you man or woman, family or tribe, whose heart has been turned away this day from the Lord our God, so as to go and serve the gods of those nations. For then there would be among you a root springing forth gall and bitterness.
verses.textLa: Ne forte sit inter vos vir aut mulier, familia aut tribus, cuius cor aversum est hodie a Domino Deo nostro: ut vadat et serviat diis illarum gentium: et sit inter vos radix germinans fel et amaritudinem.

verses.textEn: And if he were to hear the words of this oath, he would bless himself in his own heart saying: ‘There will be peace for me, and I will walk in the depravity of my heart.’ And so, the one who is inebriated would consume the one who is thirsty.
verses.textLa: Cumque audierit verba iuramenti huius, benedicat sibi in corde suo, dicens: Pax erit mihi, et ambulabo in pravitate cordis mei: et absumat ebria sitientem,

verses.textEn: But the Lord would not ignore him. Instead, at that time, his fury and zealousness would be very greatly enflamed against that man, and all the curses which have been written in this volume would settle upon him. And the Lord would abolish his name from under heaven,
verses.textLa: et Dominus non ignoscat ei: sed tunc quam maxime furor eius fumet, et zelus contra hominem illum, et sedeant super eum omnia maledicta, quæ scripta sunt in hoc volumine: et deleat Dominus nomen eius sub cælo,

verses.textEn: and consume him unto perdition out of all the tribes of Israel, according to the curses which are contained in the book of this law and in the covenant.
verses.textLa: et consumat eum in perditionem ex omnibus tribubus Israel, iuxta maledictiones, quæ in Libro legis huius ac fœderis continentur.

verses.textEn: And the subsequent generation would speak out, along with the sons who will be born afterward. And the sojourners, who will arrive from far away, will see the plagues of that land and the infirmities with which the Lord will have afflicted it,
verses.textLa: Dicetque sequens generatio, et filii qui nascentur deinceps, et peregrini, qui de longe venerint, videntes plagas Terræ illius, et infirmitates, quibus eam afflixerit Dominus,

verses.textEn: having burned it with sulphur and molten salt, so that it can no longer be sown. And certainly no greenery would spring up, as in the example of the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the Lord overturned with his wrath and fury.
verses.textLa: sulphure, et salis ardore comburens, ita ut ultra non seratur, nec virens quippiam germinet, in exemplum subversionis Sodomæ et Gomorrhæ, Adamæ et Seboim, quas subvertit Dominus in ira et furore suo.

verses.textEn: And so, all the nations would say: ‘Why has the Lord acted this way toward this land? What is this immense wrath of his fury?’
verses.textLa: Et dicent omnes gentes: Quare sic fecit Dominus Terræ huic? Quæ est hæc ira furoris eius immensa?

verses.textEn: And they will respond: ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord, which he formed with their fathers, when he led them away from the land of Egypt.
verses.textLa: Et respondebunt: Quia dereliquerunt pactum Domini, quod pepigit cum patribus eorum, quando eduxit eos de Terra Ægypti:

verses.textEn: And they have served foreign gods, and adored them, though they did not know them, and though they had not been allotted to them.
verses.textLa: et servierunt diis alienis, et adoraverunt eos, quos nesciebant, et quibus non fuerant attributi:

verses.textEn: For this reason, the fury of the Lord was enraged against this land, so as to lead over it all the curses which have been written in this volume.
verses.textLa: idcirco iratus est furor Domini contra Terram istam, ut induceret super eam omnia maledicta, quæ in hoc volumine scripta sunt:

verses.textEn: And he has cast them out of their own land, with anger and fury, and with a very great indignation, and he has thrown them into a strange land, just as has been proven this day.’
verses.textLa: et eiecit eos de terra sua in ira et in furore, et in indignatione maxima, proiecitque in terram alienam, sicut hodie comprobatur.

verses.textEn: These hidden things of the Lord our God have been revealed to us and to our sons in perpetuity, so that we may accomplish all the words of this law.”
verses.textLa: Abscondita, Domino Deo nostro: quæ manifesta sunt, nobis et filiis nostris usque in sempiternum, ut faciamus universa verba legis huius.

verses.textEn: “Now when all these things will have fallen over you, the blessing or the curse that I have set forth in your sight, and you will have been led to repentance in your heart among all the nations to which the Lord your God will have dispersed you,
verses.textLa: Cum ergo venerint super te omnes sermones isti, benedictio, sive maledictio, quam proposui in conspectu tuo: et ductus pœnitudine cordis tui in universis gentibus, in quas disperserit te Dominus Deus tuus,

verses.textEn: and when you will have returned to him, so as to obey his commandments, just as I have instructed you this day, with your sons, with your whole heart and with your whole soul,
verses.textLa: et reversus fueris ad eum, et obedieris eius imperiis, sicut ego hodie præcipio tibi, cum filiis tuis, in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua:

verses.textEn: then the Lord your God will lead you away from your captivity, and he will take pity on you, and he will gather you again from all the nations to which he had dispersed you before.
verses.textLa: reducet Dominus Deus tuus captivitatem tuam, ac miserebitur tui, et rursum congregabit te de cunctis populis, in quos te ante dispersit.

verses.textEn: Even if you will have been scattered as far as the poles of the heavens, the Lord your God will retrieve you from there.
verses.textLa: Si ad cardines cæli fueris dissipatus, inde te retrahet Dominus Deus tuus,

verses.textEn: And he will take you up and lead you into the land which your fathers had possessed, and you shall obtain it. And in blessing you, he will make you greater in number than your fathers ever were.
verses.textLa: et assumet, atque introducet in Terram, quam possederunt patres tui, et obtinebis eam: et benedicens tibi, maioris numeri te esse faciat quam fuerunt patres tui.

verses.textEn: The Lord your God will circumcise your heart, and the heart of your offspring, so that you may love the Lord your God with your entire heart and with your entire soul, so that you may be able to live.
verses.textLa: Circumcidet Dominus Deus tuus cor tuum, et cor seminis tui: ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua, ut possis vivere.

verses.textEn: And he will turn all these curses upon your enemies, and upon those who hate and persecute you.
verses.textLa: Omnes autem maledictiones has convertet super inimicos tuos, et eos, qui oderunt te et persequuntur.

verses.textEn: But you shall return, and you shall listen to the voice of the Lord your God. And you shall carry out all the commandments which I am entrusting to you this day.
verses.textLa: Tu autem reverteris, et audies vocem Domini Dei tui: faciesque universa mandata quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie:

verses.textEn: And the Lord your God will cause you to abound in all the works of your hands, in the progeny of your womb, and in the fruit of your cattle, in the fertility of your land, and with an abundance of all things. For the Lord will return, so that he may rejoice over you in all good things, just as he rejoiced in your fathers:
verses.textLa: et abundare te faciet Dominus Deus tuus in cunctis operibus manuum tuarum, in sobole uteri tui, et in fructu iumentorum tuorum, in ubertate terræ tuæ, et in rerum omnium largitate. Revertetur enim Dominus, ut gaudeat super te in omnibus bonis, sicut gavisus est in patribus tuis:

verses.textEn: but only if you will listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and keep his precepts and ceremonies, which have been written in this law, and only if you return to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.textLa: si tamen audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, et custodieris præcepta eius et ceremonias, quæ in hac lege conscripta sunt: et revertaris ad Dominum Deum tuum in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua.

verses.textEn: This commandment, which I entrust to you today, is not high above you, nor has it been placed far away.
verses.textLa: Mandatum hoc, quod ego præcipio tibi hodie, non supra te est, neque procul positum,

verses.textEn: Nor is it in heaven, so that you would be able to say, ‘Which of us can ascend to heaven, so as to carry it back to us, and so that we may hear it and fulfill it in deed?’
verses.textLa: nec in cælo situm, ut possis dicere: Quis nostrum valet ad cælum ascendere, ut deferat illud ad nos, et audiamus atque opere compleamus?

verses.textEn: Nor is it beyond the sea, so that you would excuse yourself by saying, ‘Which of us is able to cross the sea, and to carry it back to us, so that we may be able to hear and to do what has been instructed?’
verses.textLa: Neque trans mare positum: ut causeris, et dicas: Quis ex nobis poterit transfretare mare, et illud ad nos usque deferre: ut possimus audire, et facere quod præceptum est?

verses.textEn: Instead, the word is near to you, in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may do it.
verses.textLa: Sed iuxta te est sermo valde, in ore tuo, et in corde tuo, ut facias illum.

verses.textEn: Consider what I have set forth in your sight this day, life and good, or, on the opposite side, death and evil,
verses.textLa: Considera quod hodie proposuerim in conspectu tuo vitam et bonum, et econtrario mortem et malum:

verses.textEn: so that you may love the Lord your God, and walk in his ways, and keep his commandments and ceremonies and judgments, and so that you may live, and he may multiply you and bless you in the land, which you shall enter in order to possess.
verses.textLa: ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum, et ambules in viis eius, et custodias mandata illius ac ceremonias atque iudicia: et vivas, atque multiplicet te, benedicatque tibi in Terra, ad quam ingredieris possidendam.

verses.textEn: But if your heart will have been turned aside, so that you are not willing to listen, and, having been deceived by error, you adore strange gods and serve them,
verses.textLa: Si autem aversum fuerit cor tuum, et audire nolueris, atque errore deceptus adoraveris deos alienos, et servieris eis:

verses.textEn: then I predict to you this day that you will perish, and you will remain for only a short time in the land, for which you shall cross the Jordan, and which you shall enter in order to possess.
verses.textLa: prædico tibi hodie quod pereas, et parvo tempore moreris in Terra, ad quam, Iordane transmisso, ingredieris possidendam.

verses.textEn: I call heaven and earth as witnesses this day, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore, choose life, so that both you and your offspring may live,
verses.textLa: Testes invoco hodie cælum et terram, quod proposuerim vobis vitam et mortem, benedictionem et maledictionem. Elige ergo vitam, ut et tu vivas, et semen tuum:

verses.textEn: and so that you may love the Lord your God, and obey his voice, and cling to him, (for he is your life and the length of your days) and so that you may live in the land, about which the Lord swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, that he would give it to them.”
verses.textLa: et diligas Dominum Deum tuum, atque obedias voci eius, et illi adhæreas (ipse est enim vita tua, et longitudo dierum tuorum) ut habites in Terra, pro qua iuravit Dominus patribus tuis, Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob, ut daret eam illis.

verses.textEn: And so, Moses went out, and he spoke all these words to all of Israel.
verses.textLa: Abiit itaque Moyses, et locutus est omnia verba hæc ad universum Israel,

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “Today, I am one hundred and twenty years old. I am no longer able to go out and return, especially since the Lord has also said to me, ‘You shall not cross this Jordan.’
verses.textLa: et dixit ad eos: Centum viginti annorum sum hodie, non possum ultra egredi, et ingredi, præsertim cum et Dominus dixerit mihi: Non transibis Iordanem istum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Lord your God will go across before you. He himself will abolish all these nations in your sight, and you shall possess them. And this man Joshua shall go across before you, just as the Lord has spoken.
verses.textLa: Dominus ergo Deus tuus transibit ante te: ipse delebit omnes gentes has in conspectu tuo, et possidebis eas: et Iosue iste transibit ante te, sicut locutus est Dominus.

verses.textEn: And the Lord will do to them just as he did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land, and he will wipe them away.
verses.textLa: Facietque Dominus eis sicut fecit Sehon et Og regibus Amorrhæorum, et terræ eorum, delebitque eos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, when the Lord will have delivered these to you also, you shall act similarly toward them, just as I have instructed you.
verses.textLa: Cum ergo et hos tradiderit vobis, similiter facietis eis sicut præcepi vobis.

verses.textEn: Act manfully and be strengthened. Do not be afraid, and do not dread at the sight of them. For the Lord your God himself is your commander, and he will neither dismiss nor abandon you.”
verses.textLa: Viriliter agite, et confortamini: nolite timere, nec paveatis ad conspectum eorum: quia Dominus Deus tuus ipse est ductor tuus, et non dimittet, nec derelinquet te.

verses.textEn: And Moses called Joshua, and, before all of Israel, he said to him: ‘Be strong and valiant. For you shall lead this people into the land which the Lord swore that he would give to their fathers, and you shall divide it by lot.
verses.textLa: Vocavitque Moyses Iosue, et dixit ei coram omni Israel: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim introduces populum istum in Terram, quam daturum se patribus eorum iuravit Dominus, et tu eam sorte divides.

verses.textEn: And the Lord, who is your commander, will himself be with you. He will neither renounce nor abandon you. Do not be afraid, and do not dread.”
verses.textLa: Et Dominus qui ductor est vester, ipse erit tecum: non dimittet, nec derelinquet te: noli timere, nec paveas.

verses.textEn: And so, Moses wrote this law, and he handed it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.
verses.textLa: Scripsit itaque Moyses legem hanc, et tradidit eam sacerdotibus filiis Levi, qui portabant arcam fœderis Domini, et cunctis senioribus Israel.

verses.textEn: And he instructed them, saying: “After seven years, in the year of remission, at the solemnity of the Feast of Tabernacles,
verses.textLa: Præcepitque eis, dicens: Post septem annos, anno remissionis, in sollemnitate tabernaculorum,

verses.textEn: when all of Israel has convened in order to appear in the sight of the Lord your God, in the place which the Lord will choose, you shall read the words of this law before all of Israel, in their hearing.
verses.textLa: convenientibus cunctis ex Israel, ut appareant in conspectu Domini Dei tui in loco, quem elegerit Dominus, leges verba legis huius coram omni Israel, audientibus eis,

verses.textEn: And when the people have gathered together, men as well as women and little children, and the new arrivals who are within your gates, they shall listen so that they may learn, and may fear the Lord your God, and may keep and fulfill all the words of this law,
verses.textLa: et in unum omni populo congregato, tam viris quam mulieribus, parvulis, et advenis, qui sunt intra portas tuas: ut audientes discant, et timeant Dominum Deum vestrum, et custodiant, impleantque omnes sermones legis huius.

verses.textEn: and also so that their sons, who are now ignorant, may be able to listen, and may fear the Lord their God all the days that they live in the land to which you will travel, crossing the Jordan in order to obtain it.”
verses.textLa: Filii quoque eorum qui nunc ignorant; ut audire possint, et timeant Dominum Deum suum cunctis diebus quibus versantur in Terra, ad quam vos, Iordane transmisso, pergitis obtinendam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses: “Behold, the days of your death draw near. Call Joshua, and stand in the tabernacle of the testimony, so that I may instruct him.” Therefore, Moses and Joshua went and stood in the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: Et ait Dominus ad Moysen: Ecce prope sunt dies mortis tuæ: voca Iosue, et state in tabernaculo testimonii, ut præcipiam ei. Abierunt ergo Moyses et Iosue, et steterunt in tabernaculo testimonii:

verses.textEn: And the Lord appeared there, in a pillar of cloud, which stood at the entrance of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: apparuitque Dominus ibi in columna nubis, quæ stetit in introitu tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses: “Behold, you shall sleep with your fathers, and this people will rise up and will fornicate after foreign gods, in the land which they will enter so that they may live in it. In that place, they will forsake me, and they will make void the covenant that I have formed with them.
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Ecce tu dormies cum patribus tuis, et populus iste consurgens fornicabitur post deos alienos in Terra, ad quam ingreditur ut habitet in ea: ibi derelinquet me, et irritum faciet fœdus, quod pepigi cum eo.

verses.textEn: And my fury will be enraged against them in that day. And I will abandon them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured. Every evil and affliction will find them, so much so that they will say in that day: ‘Truly, it is because God is not with me that these evils have found me.’
verses.textLa: Et irascetur furor meus contra eum in die illo: et derelinquam eum, et abscondam faciem meam ab eo, et erit in devorationem: invenient eum omnia mala et afflictiones, ita ut dicat in illo die: Vere quia non est Deus mecum, invenerunt me hæc mala.

verses.textEn: But I will hide myself, and I will conceal my face in that day, because of all the evils that they have done, because they have followed strange gods.
verses.textLa: Ego autem abscondam, et celabo faciem meam in die illo propter omnia mala, quæ fecit, quia secutus est deos alienos.

verses.textEn: And so, write this canticle now, and teach it to the sons of Israel, so that they may retain it in memory, and may chant it by mouth, and so that this verse may be a testimony to me among the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Nunc itaque scribite vobis canticum istud, et docete filios Israel: ut memoriter teneant, et ore decantent, et sit mihi carmen istud pro testimonio inter filios Israel.

verses.textEn: For I will lead them into the land, about which I swore to their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey. And when they have eaten, and have been satiated and fattened, they will turn aside to foreign gods, and they will serve them. And they will disparage me, and they will nullify my covenant.
verses.textLa: Introducam enim eum in Terram, pro qua iuravi patribus eius, lacte et melle manantem. Cumque comederint, et saturati, crassique fuerint, avertentur ad deos alienos, et servient eis: detrahentque mihi, et irritum facient pactum meum.

verses.textEn: And after many evils and afflictions have overwhelmed them, this canticle will answer them as a testimony; it shall never pass into oblivion, away from the mouths of their offspring. For I know their thoughts and what they are about to do today, even before I lead them into the land which I have promised to them.”
verses.textLa: Postquam invenerint eum mala multa et afflictiones, respondebit ei canticum istud pro testimonio, quod nulla delebit oblivio ex ore seminis sui. Scio enim cogitationes eius, quæ facturus sit hodie, antequam introducam eum in Terram, quam ei pollicitus sum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses wrote the canticle, and he taught it to the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Scripsit ergo Moyses canticum, et docuit filios Israel.

verses.textEn: And the Lord instructed Joshua, the son of Nun, and he said: “Be strong and valiant. For you shall lead the sons of Israel into the land which I have promised, and I will be with you.”
verses.textLa: Præcepitque Dominus Iosue filio Nun, et ait: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim introduces filios Israel in Terram, quam pollicitus sum, et ego ero tecum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, after Moses had written the words of this law in a volume, and had finished it,
verses.textLa: Postquam ergo scripsit Moyses verba legis huius in volumine, atque complevit:

verses.textEn: he instructed the Levites, who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, saying:
verses.textLa: præcepit Levitis, qui portabant arcam fœderis Domini, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Take this book, and place it inside the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, so that it may be there as a testimony against you.
verses.textLa: Tollite librum istum, et ponite eum in latere arcæ fœderis Domini Dei vestri: ut sit ibi contra te in testimonium.

verses.textEn: For I know your contentiousness and your very stiff neck. Even while I am still living and entering with you, you have always acted with contention against the Lord. How much more so when I will be dead?
verses.textLa: Ego enim scio contentionem tuam, et cervicem tuam durissimam. Adhuc vivente me et ingrediente vobiscum, semper contentiose egistis contra Dominum: quanto magis cum mortuus fuero?

verses.textEn: Gather to me all those greater by birth throughout your tribes, as well as your teachers, and I will speak these words in their hearing, and I will call heaven and earth as witnesses against them.
verses.textLa: Congregate ad me omnes maiores natu per tribus vestras, atque doctores, et loquar audientibus eis sermones istos, et invocabo contra eos cælum et terram.

verses.textEn: For I know that, after my death, you will act with iniquity, and you will quickly depart from the way that I have instructed to you. And so, evils will meet you in the end time, when you will have done evil in the sight of the Lord so as to provoke him through the works of your hands.”
verses.textLa: Novi enim quod post mortem meam inique agetis, et declinabitis cito de via, quam præcepi vobis: et occurrent vobis mala in extremo tempore, quando feceritis malum in conspectu Domini, ut irritetis eum per opera manuum vestrarum.

verses.textEn: Thus did Moses speak, in the hearing of the entire assembly of Israel, the words of this canticle, and he completed it to its very end.
verses.textLa: Locutus est ergo Moyses, audiente universo cœtu Israel, verba carminis huius, et ad finem usque complevit.

verses.textEn: “Listen, O heavens, to what I am saying. Let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
verses.textLa: Audite cæli quæ loquor, audiat terra verba oris mei.

verses.textEn: Let my doctrine accumulate like the rain. Let my eloquence form like the dew, like a mist upon the plants, and like water droplets upon the grass.
verses.textLa: Concrescat ut pluvia doctrina mea, fluat ut ros eloquium meum, quasi imber super herbam, et quasi stillæ super gramina.

verses.textEn: For I will invoke the name of the Lord. Acknowledge the magnificence of our God!
verses.textLa: Quia nomen Domini invocabo: date magnificentiam Deo nostro.

verses.textEn: The works of God are perfect, and all his ways are judgments. God is faithful and without any iniquity. He is just and upright.
verses.textLa: Dei perfecta sunt opera, et omnes viæ eius iudicia: Deus fidelis, et absque ulla iniquitate, iustus et rectus.

verses.textEn: They have sinned against him, and in their filth they are not his sons. They are a depraved and perverse generation.
verses.textLa: Peccaverunt ei, et non filii eius in sordibus: generatio prava atque perversa.

verses.textEn: How can this be the return you would offer to the Lord, O foolish and senseless people? Is he himself not your Father, who has possessed you, and made you, and created you?
verses.textLa: Hæccine reddis Domino popule stulte et insipiens? Numquid non ipse est Pater tuus, qui possedit te, et fecit, et creavit te?

verses.textEn: Remember the days of antiquity. Consider each generation. Question your father, and he will declare it to you. Question your elders, and they will tell it to you.
verses.textLa: Memento dierum antiquorum, cogita generationes singulas: interroga patrem tuum, et annunciabit tibi: maiores tuos, et dicent tibi.

verses.textEn: When the Most High divided the nations, when he separated the sons of Adam, he appointed the limits of the peoples according to the number of the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Quando dividebat Altissimus gentes: quando separabat filios Adam, constituit terminos populorum iuxta numerum filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: But the Lord’s portion is his people: Jacob, the lot of his inheritance.
verses.textLa: Pars autem Domini, populus eius: Iacob funiculus hereditatis eius.

verses.textEn: He discovered him in a desert land, in a place of horror and a vast wilderness. He led him around and taught him, and he guarded him like the pupil of his eye,
verses.textLa: Invenit eum in terra deserta, in loco horroris, et vastæ solitudinis: circumduxit eum, et docuit: et custodivit quasi pupillam oculi sui.

verses.textEn: just as an eagle encourages its young to fly, and, flying above them, stretches out its wings, and takes them up, and carries them on its shoulders.
verses.textLa: Sicut aquila provocans ad volandum pullos suos, et super eos volitans, expandit alas suas, et assumpsit eum, atque portavit in humeris suis.

verses.textEn: The Lord alone was his leader, and there was no strange god with him.
verses.textLa: Dominus solus dux eius fuit: et non erat cum eo deus alienus.

verses.textEn: He stood him upon an exalted land, so that he might eat the fruits of the fields, so that he might eat honey from the rock, and oil from the hardest stone,
verses.textLa: Constituit eum super excelsam terram: ut comederet fructus agrorum, ut sugeret mel de petra, oleumque de saxo durissimo.

verses.textEn: butter from the herd, and milk from the sheep, with fat from the lambs, and with rams and goats from the sons of Bashan, with the kernel of the wheat, and so that he might drink the undiluted blood of the grape.
verses.textLa: Butyrum de armento, et lac de ovibus cum adipe agnorum, et arietum filiorum Basan, et hircos cum medulla tritici, et sanguinem uvæ biberet meracissimum.

verses.textEn: The beloved grew fat, and he kicked. Having grown fat and thick and wide, he abandoned God, his Maker, and he withdrew from God, his Savior.
verses.textLa: Incrassatus est dilectus, et recalcitravit: incrassatus, impinguatus, dilatatus, dereliquit Deum Factorem suum, et recessit a Deo salutari suo.

verses.textEn: They provoked him with strange gods, and they stirred him to anger by their abominations.
verses.textLa: Provocaverunt eum in diis alienis, et in abominationibus ad iracundiam concitaverunt.

verses.textEn: They immolated to demons and not to God, to gods whom they did not know, who were new and recent arrivals, whom their fathers did not worship.
verses.textLa: Immolaverunt dæmoniis et non Deo, diis, quos ignorabant: novi recentesque venerunt, quos non coluerunt patres eorum.

verses.textEn: You have forsaken the God who conceived you, and you have forgotten the Lord who created you.
verses.textLa: Deum, qui te genuit dereliquisti, et oblitus es Domini creatoris tui.

verses.textEn: The Lord saw, and he was stirred to anger. For his own sons and daughters provoked him.
verses.textLa: Vidit Dominus, et ad iracundiam concitatus est: quia provocaverunt eum filii sui et filiæ.

verses.textEn: And he said: ‘I will hide my face from them, and I will consider their very end. For this is a perverse generation, and they are unfaithful sons.
verses.textLa: Et ait: Abscondam faciem meam ab eis, et considerabo novissima eorum: generatio enim perversa est, et infideles filii.

verses.textEn: They have provoked me with that which was not God, and they have angered me with their emptiness. And so, I will provoke them with that which is not a people, and I will anger them with a foolish nation.
verses.textLa: Ipsi me provocaverunt in eo, qui non erat Deus, et irritaverunt in vanitatibus suis: et ego provocabo eos in eo, qui non est populus, et in gente stulta irritabo illos.

verses.textEn: A fire has been kindled in my fury, and it will burn even to the deepest Hell, and it will devour the earth with its produce, and it will burn the foundations of the mountains.
verses.textLa: Ignis succensus est in furore meo, et ardebit usque ad inferni novissima: devorabitque terram cum germine suo, et montium fundamenta comburet.

verses.textEn: I will heap evils upon them, and I will expend my arrows among them.
verses.textLa: Congregabo super eos mala, et sagittas meas complebo in eis.

verses.textEn: They will be consumed by famine, and birds with a very bitter bite will devour them. I will send forth the teeth of wild beasts among them, along with the fury of creatures that scurry across the ground, and of serpents.
verses.textLa: Consumentur fame, et devorabunt eos aves morsu amarissimo: dentes bestiarum immittam in eos, cum furore trahentium super terram, atque serpentium.

verses.textEn: Outside, the sword will devastate them; and inside, there will be dread, as much for the young man as for the maiden, and as much for the newborn as for the old man.
verses.textLa: Foris vastabit eos gladius, et intus pavor, iuvenem simul ac virginem, lactentem cum homine sene.

verses.textEn: I said: Where are they? I will cause their memory to cease from among men.
verses.textLa: Dixi: Ubinam sunt? Cessare faciam ex hominibus memoriam eorum.

verses.textEn: But because of the wrath of the enemies, I have delayed it. Otherwise, perhaps their enemies would be arrogant and would say: “Our exalted hand, and not the Lord, has done all these things.”
verses.textLa: Sed propter iram inimicorum distuli: ne forte superbirent hostes eorum, et dicerent: Manus nostra excelsa, et non Dominus, fecit hæc omnia.

verses.textEn: They are a nation without counsel and without prudence.
verses.textLa: Gens absque consilio est, et sine prudentia.

verses.textEn: I wish that they would be wise and understanding, and would provide for the very end.’
verses.textLa: Utinam saperent, et intelligerent, ac novissima providerent.

verses.textEn: How is it that one pursues a thousand, and two chases ten thousand? Is it not because their God has sold them, and because the Lord has enclosed them?
verses.textLa: Quo modo persequatur unus mille, et duo fugent decem millia? Nonne ideo, quia Deus suus vendidit eos, et Dominus conclusit illos?

verses.textEn: For our God is not like their gods. And our enemies are judges.
verses.textLa: Non enim est Deus noster ut dii eorum: et inimici nostri sunt iudices.

verses.textEn: Their vines are of the vines of Sodom, but from the suburbs of Gomorrah. Their grapes are the grapes of gall, and their grape clusters are most bitter.
verses.textLa: De vinea Sodomorum, vinea eorum, et de suburbanis Gomorrhæ: uva eorum uva fellis, et botri amarissimi.

verses.textEn: Their wine is the gall of snakes, and it is the incurable venom of asps.
verses.textLa: Fel draconum vinum eorum, et venenum aspidum insanabile.

verses.textEn: ‘Have not these things been stored up with me, and sealed up amid my treasures?
verses.textLa: Nonne hæc condita sunt apud me, et signata in thesauris meis?

verses.textEn: Vengeance is mine, and I will repay them in due time, so that their foot may slip and fall. The day of perdition is near, and the time rushes to appear.’
verses.textLa: Mea est ultio, et ego retribuam in tempore, ut labatur pes eorum: iuxta est dies perditionis, et adesse festinant tempora.

verses.textEn: The Lord will judge his people, and he will take pity on his servants. He will see that their hand has been weakened, and that those who have been enclosed have likewise failed, and that those who have been left behind have been consumed.
verses.textLa: Iudicabit Dominus populum suum, et in servis suis miserebitur: videbit quod infirmata sit manus, et clausi quoque defecerunt, residuique consumpti sunt.

verses.textEn: And he shall say: ‘Where are their gods, in whom they had confidence?
verses.textLa: Et dicet: Ubi sunt dii eorum, in quibus habebant fiduciam?

verses.textEn: They ate the fat of their victims, and they drank the wine of their libations. So let these rise up, and bring relief to you, and protect you in your distress.
verses.textLa: De quorum victimis comedebant adipes, et bibebant vinum libaminum: surgant, et opitulentur vobis, et in necessitate vos protegant.

verses.textEn: See that I am alone, and there is no other god beside me. I will kill, and I will cause to live. I will strike, and I will heal. And there is no one who is able to rescue from my hand.
verses.textLa: Videte quod ego sim solus, et non sit alius deus præter me: ego occidam, et ego vivere faciam: percutiam, et ego sanabo, et non est qui de manu mea possit eruere.

verses.textEn: I will lift up my hand to heaven, and I will say: I live in eternity.
verses.textLa: Levabo ad cælum manum meam, et dicam: Vivo ego in æternum.

verses.textEn: When I sharpen my sword like lightning, and my hand takes hold of judgment, then I will render vengeance to my enemies, and I will repay those who hate me.
verses.textLa: Si acuero ut fulgur gladium meum, et arripuerit iudicium manus mea: reddam ultionem hostibus meis, et his qui oderunt me retribuam.

verses.textEn: I will inebriate my arrows with blood, and my sword will devour flesh: from the blood of the slain and from the captive, from the exposed head of the enemies.’
verses.textLa: Inebriabo sagittas meas sanguine, et gladius meus devorabit carnes, de cruore occisorum, et de captivitate, nudati inimicorum capitis.

verses.textEn: You nations, praise his people! For he will avenge the blood of his servants. And he will distribute vengeance to their enemies. And he will be merciful to the land of his people.”
verses.textLa: Laudate gentes populum eius, quia sanguinem servorum suorum ulciscetur: et vindictam retribuet in hostes eorum, et propitius erit terræ populi sui.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses went and spoke all the words of this canticle to the ears of the people, both he and Joshua, the son of Nun.
verses.textLa: Venit ergo Moyses, et locutus est omnia verba cantici huius in auribus populi, ipse et Iosue filius Nun.

verses.textEn: And he completed all these words, speaking to all of Israel.
verses.textLa: Complevitque omnes sermones istos, loquens ad universum Israel.

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “Set your hearts upon all the words which I am testifying to you this day. So shall you command your sons, to keep, and to do, and to fulfill all the things that have been written in this law.
verses.textLa: Et dixit ad eos: Ponite corda vestra in omnia verba, quæ ego testificor vobis hodie: ut mandetis ea filiis vestris custodire et facere, et implere universa quæ scripta sunt legis huius:

verses.textEn: For these things have not been entrusted to you to no purpose, but so that each one would live by them, and so that, in doing these, you may continue for a long time in the land, which you will enter upon crossing the Jordan in order to possess it.”
verses.textLa: quia non incassum præcepta sunt vobis, sed ut singuli in eis viverent: quæ facientes longo perseveretis tempore in Terra, ad quam, Iordane transmisso, ingredimini possidendam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses on the same day, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in eadem die, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Ascend this mountain, Abarim, (that is, of crossings) onto Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, opposite Jericho, and look upon the land of Canaan, which I will deliver to the sons of Israel to obtain it. And you shall die upon the mountain.
verses.textLa: Ascende in montem istum Abarim, id est, transitum, in montem Nebo, qui est in Terra Moab contra Iericho: et vide Terram Chanaan, quam ego tradam filiis Israel obtinendam, et morere in monte.

verses.textEn: After climbing it, you will be joined to your people, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor, and was placed with his people.
verses.textLa: Quem conscendens iungeris populis tuis, sicut mortuus est Aaron frater tuus in monte Hor, et appositus populis suis:

verses.textEn: For you trespassed against me in the midst of the sons of Israel, at the Waters of Contradiction, in Kadesh, in the desert of Sin. And you did not sanctify me among the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: quia prævaricati estis contra me in medio filiorum Israel ad Aquas contradictionis in Cades deserti Sin: et non sanctificastis me inter filios Israel.

verses.textEn: You shall see the land opposite you, which I will give to the sons of Israel, but you shall not enter into it.”
verses.textLa: Econtra videbis terram, et non ingredieris in eam, quam ego dabo filiis Israel.

verses.textEn: This is the blessing, with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the sons of Israel before his death.
verses.textLa: Hæc est benedictio, qua benedixit Moyses, homo Dei, filiis Israel ante mortem suam.

verses.textEn: And he said: “The Lord went forth from Sinai, and he arose for us from Seir. He appeared from Mount Paran, and thousands of holy ones were with him. The fiery law was in his right hand.
verses.textLa: Et ait: Dominus de Sinai venit, et de Seir ortus est nobis: apparuit de monte Pharan, et cum eo sanctorum millia. In dextera eius ignea lex.

verses.textEn: He loved the people; all the holy ones are in his hand. And those who approach his feet shall receive from his doctrine.
verses.textLa: Dilexit populos, omnes sancti in manu illius sunt: et qui appropinquant pedibus eius, accipient de doctrina illius.

verses.textEn: Moses instructed us in the law, the inheritance of the multitude of Jacob.
verses.textLa: Legem præcepit nobis Moyses, hereditatem multitudinis Iacob.

verses.textEn: The king shall have great righteousness, at the gathering of the princes of the people with the tribes of Israel.
verses.textLa: Erit apud rectissimum rex, congregatis principibus populi cum tribubus Israel.

verses.textEn: Let Ruben live, and not die, and may he be small in number.”
verses.textLa: Vivat Ruben, et non moriatur, et sit parvus in numero.

verses.textEn: This is the blessing of Judah. “Hear, O Lord, the voice of Judah, and lead him to his people. His hands shall fight for him, and he shall be his helper against his adversaries.”
verses.textLa: Hæc est Iudæ benedicio: Audi Domine vocem Iudæ, et ad populum suum introduc eum: manus eius pugnabunt pro eo, et adiutor illius contra adversarios eius erit.

verses.textEn: Likewise, to Levi he said: “Your perfection and your doctrine are for your holy man, whom you have proven by temptation, and whom you have judged at the Waters of Contradiction.
verses.textLa: Levi quoque ait: Perfectio tua, et doctrina tua viro sancto tuo, quem probasti in tentatione, et iudicasti ad Aquas contradictionis.

verses.textEn: He has said to his father and to his mother, ‘I do not know you,’ and to his brothers, ‘I will disregard you.’ And they have not known their own sons. Such as these have kept your word and have observed your covenant:
verses.textLa: Qui dixit patri suo, et matri suæ: Nescio vos; et fratribus suis: Ignoro vos: et nescierunt filios suos. Hi custodierunt eloquium tuum, et pactum tuum servaverunt,
verses.notes: This passage indicates that the Levites have set aside their families (father and mother and brothers), to serve the Lord faithfully. Similarly, Christ said that His followers must ‘hate’ their father and mother and brothers.

verses.textEn: your judgments, O Jacob, and your law, O Israel. They shall place incense before your fury and a holocaust upon your altar.
verses.textLa: iudicia tua o Iacob, et legem tuam o Israel: ponent thymiama in furore tuo, et holocaustum super altare tuum.

verses.textEn: O Lord, bless his strength, and receive the works of his hands. Strike the backs of his enemies, and do not let those who hate him rise up.”
verses.textLa: Benedic Domine fortitudini eius, et opera manuum illius suscipe. Percute dorsa inimicorum eius: et qui oderunt eum, non consurgant.

verses.textEn: And to Benjamin he said: “The most beloved of the Lord will live confidently in him. He shall remain all day long, as if in a bridal chamber, and he shall rest amid her arms.”
verses.textLa: Et Beniamin ait: Amantissimus Domini habitabit confidenter in eo: quasi in thalamo tota die morabitur, et inter humeros illius requiescet.
verses.notes: The figure used here is of the Church as a Bride. Benjamin will rest amid her arms, for he has wedded himself to the Church as to a bride.

verses.textEn: Likewise, to Joseph he said: “His land shall be from the blessing of the Lord, from the fruits of heaven, and from the dew, and from the abyss which lies below,
verses.textLa: Ioseph quoque ait: De benedictione Domini terra eius, de pomis cæli, et rore, atque abysso subiacente,

verses.textEn: from the fruits of the crops under the sun and the moon,
verses.textLa: de pomis fructuum solis ac lunæ,

verses.textEn: from the heights of the ancient mountains, from the fruits of the everlasting hills,
verses.textLa: de vertice antiquorum montium, de pomis collium æternorum:

verses.textEn: and from the fruits of the earth with all its plenitude. May the blessing of him who appeared in the bush, settle upon the head of Joseph, and upon the top of the head of the Nazarite among his brothers.
verses.textLa: et de frugibus terræ, et de plenitudine eius. Benedictio illius, qui apparuit in rubo, veniat super caput Ioseph, et super verticem Nazaræi inter fratres suos.

verses.textEn: His excellence is like that of a first-born bull. His horns are like the horns of a rhinoceros; he shall brandish these against the Gentiles, even to the ends of the earth. These are the multitudes of Ephraim, and these the thousands of Manasseh.”
verses.textLa: Quasi primogeniti tauri pulchritudo eius, cornua rhinocerotis cornua illius: in ipsis ventilabit Gentes usque ad terminos terræ. Hæ sunt multitudines Ephraim: et hæc millia Manasse.

verses.textEn: And to Zebulun he said: “Rejoice, O Zebulun, in your departure, and Issachar, in your tabernacles.
verses.textLa: Et Zabulon ait: Lætare Zabulon in exitu tuo, et Issachar in tabernaculis tuis.

verses.textEn: They shall summon the peoples to the mountain. There, they shall immolate the victims of justice, who feed on the flood of the sea, as if on milk, and on the hidden treasures of the sands.”
verses.textLa: Populos vocabunt ad montem: ibi immolabunt victimas iustitiæ. Qui inundationem maris quasi lac sugent, et thesauros absconditos arenarum.

verses.textEn: And to Gad he said: “Blessed is Gad in his breadth. He has rested like a lion, and he has seized the arm and the top of the head.
verses.textLa: Et Gad ait: Benedictus in latitudine Gad: quasi leo requievit, cepitque brachium et verticem.

verses.textEn: And he has seen his own pre-eminence, which his teacher has stored up as his portion. He was with the princes of the people, and he accomplished the justices of the Lord, and his judgment with Israel.”
verses.textLa: Et vidit principatum suum, quod in parte sua doctor esset repositus: qui fuit cum principibus populi, et fecit iustitias Domini, et iudicium suum cum Israel.

verses.textEn: Likewise, to Dan he said: “Dan is a young lion. He shall flow plentifully from Bashan.”
verses.textLa: Dan quoque ait: Dan catulus leonis, fluet largiter de Basan.
verses.notes: Dan is thought to be the tribe from which the mother of the Antichrist is descended. Notice that his blessing is limited and worldly: he will be fierce and aggressive like a young lion, but not wise or restrained like an older lion. He will be numerous (or have numerous followers), but no holiness is described for this great multitude.

verses.textEn: And to Naphtali he said: “Naphtali shall enjoy abundance, and he shall be full of the blessings of the Lord. He shall possess the sea and the Meridian.”
verses.textLa: Et Nephthali dixit: Nephthali abundantia perfruetur, et plenus erit benedictionibus Domini: mare et meridiem possidebit.

verses.textEn: Likewise, to Asher he said: “Let Asher be blessed with sons. Let him be pleasing to his brothers, and let him dip his foot in oil.
verses.textLa: Aser quoque ait: Benedictus in filiis Aser, sit placens fratribus suis, et tingat in oleo pedem suum.

verses.textEn: His shoe shall be of iron and of brass. As were the days of your youth, so also shall be your old age.
verses.textLa: Ferrum et æs calceamentum eius. Sicut dies iuventutis tuæ, ita et senectus tua.

verses.textEn: There is no other god like the God of the most righteous one. He who rides upon the heavens is your helper. His magnificence scatters the clouds.
verses.textLa: Non est deus alius ut Deus rectissimi: ascensor cæli auxiliator tuus. Magnificentia eius discurrunt nubes,

verses.textEn: His habitation is above, and the everlasting arms are below. He shall cast out the enemy before your face, and he shall say: ‘Be utterly broken!’
verses.textLa: habitaculum eius sursum, et subter brachia sempiterna: eiiciet a facie tua inimicum, dicetque: Conterere.

verses.textEn: Israel shall live in confidence and alone, as the eye of Jacob in a land of grain and of wine; and the heavens shall be misty with dew.
verses.textLa: Habitabit Israel confidenter, et solus: oculus Iacob in terra frumenti et vini, cælique caligabunt rore.

verses.textEn: Blessed are you, O Israel. Who is like you, the people who are saved by the Lord? He is the shield of your assistance and the sword of your glory. Your enemies will refuse to acknowledge you, and so you shall tread upon their necks.”
verses.textLa: Beatus es tu Israel: quis similis tui popule, qui salvaris in Domino? Scutum auxilii tui, et gladius gloriæ tuæ: negabunt te inimici tui, et tu eorum colla calcabis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses ascended from the plains of Moab onto Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, opposite Jericho. And the Lord revealed to him the entire land of Gilead, as far as Dan,
verses.textLa: Ascendit ergo Moyses de campestribus Moab super montem Nebo, in verticem Phasga contra Iericho: ostenditque ei Dominus omnem Terram Galaad usque Dan,
verses.notes: Moses could only have seen all these places by Divine revelation, not by mere sight even from a lofty mountain.

verses.textEn: and all of Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and the entire land of Judah, even to the furthest sea,
verses.textLa: et universum Nephthali, terramque Ephraim et Manasse, et omnem terram Iuda usque ad mare novissimum,

verses.textEn: and the southern region, and the breadth of the plain of Jericho, the city of palms, as far as Zoar.
verses.textLa: et australem partem, et latitudinem campi Iericho civitatis palmarum usque Segor.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to him: “This is the land, about which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying: I will give it to your offspring. You have seen it with your eyes, but you shall not cross over to it.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Hæc est terra, pro qua iuravi Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob, dicens: Semini tuo dabo eam. Vidisti eam oculis tuis, et non transibis ad illam.

verses.textEn: And Moses, the servant of the Lord, died in that place, in the land of Moab, by order of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Mortuusque est ibi Moyses servus Domini, in terra Moab, iubente Domino:

verses.textEn: And he buried him in the valley of the land of Moab, opposite Peor. And no man knows where his sepulcher is, even to the present day.
verses.textLa: et sepelivit eum in valle Terræ Moab contra Phogor: et non cognovit homo sepulchrum eius usque in præsentem diem.
verses.notes: No one is permitted to know where Moses is buried so that no one will worship Moses.

verses.textEn: Moses was one hundred and twenty years old when he died. His eye was not dimmed, nor were his teeth displaced.
verses.textLa: Moyses centum et viginti annorum erat quando mortuus est: non caligavit oculus eius, nec dentes illius moti sunt.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel wept for him in the plains of Moab for thirty days. And then the days of their wailing, during which they mourned Moses, were completed.
verses.textLa: Fleveruntque eum filii Israel in campestribus Moab triginta diebus: et completi sunt dies planctus lugentium Moysen.

verses.textEn: Truly, Joshua, the son of Nun, was filled with the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands upon him. And the sons of Israel were obedient to him, and they did as the Lord instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Iosue vero filius Nun repletus est Spiritu sapientiæ, quia Moyses posuit super eum manus suas. Et obedierunt ei filii Israel, feceruntque sicut præcepit Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And no other prophet rose up in Israel like Moses, one whom the Lord knew face to face,
verses.textLa: Et non surrexit ultra propheta in Israel sicut Moyses, quem nosset Dominus facie ad faciem,

verses.textEn: one with all the signs and wonders, which he sent through him, to perform in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh, and all his servants, and his entire land,
verses.textLa: in omnibus signis atque portentis, quæ misit per eum, ut faceret in Terra Ægypti Pharaoni, et omnibus servis eius, universæque terræ illius,

verses.textEn: nor one with such a powerful hand and such great miracles as Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
verses.textLa: et cunctam manum robustam, magnaque mirabilia, quæ fecit Moyses coram universo Israel.
